title: Tower Defense Clash
detail:
Description

Tower Defense Clash is a strategic adventure where you build and oversee defensive towers. Watch as these structures autonomously combat encroaching monsters. Players pick from various tower designs and upgrade them with earned resources. Cast beneficial spells to strengthen your defenses in critical moments.

How to Play

Arrange towers strategically to block advancing monster hordes. They attack on their own. Collect resources to upgrade. Use spells strategically for extra defense. Carefully choose tower positioning. Prioritize upgrades. A helpful hint: focus on creating a balanced mix of tower types for maximum efficiency.

title: Cut The Rope 2
detail:
When you create an adorable mascot character, it's highly likely that they will carry a story to a series like Cut The Rope 2. The little spherical reptile, Om Nom, is back and still has a huge sweet tooth. There's more of a plot this time as Om Nom had gotten his stubs on lots of candy but a bunch of spiders also want some. This drives them to steal Om Nom's candy and scatter them across various worlds. Om Nom can only do so much to get them back so you'll have to

help him out by cutting the rope once again.

About Cut The Rope 2

All we ask from a sequel is that the core remains the same while the features and content surrounding it expand. This is what this title has done, adding a whole new mechanic on top of the already solid foundation. The moment you start playing, you'll get back into the familiar groove of cutting the rope and playing around with the physics objects. Then, when the new characters and their abilities are introduced, it's a smooth transition into the types of issues that you can expect to face while helping Om Nom get back his much-beloved candy. The game maintains its charm.

How to Play

Cut The Rope 2 is a 2D physics puzzle game that uses swipe and tap mechanics which are recreated by the mouse. To interact with objects in a level, move the cursor over to them and click the Left Mouse Button. To swipe, click and hold the Left Mouse Button and drag it across the area. The goal of each level is to guide a large colorful candy safely to Om Nom. To fully beat the level, you must earn three Medals. These Medals are awarded for collecting all three stars, collecting a certain amount of fruits, and accomplishing a random task.

Each level is designed as an obstacle course or a machine with moving parts. The candy will generally start somewhere suspended by a rope. It'll respond to physics like gravity and momentum, both on its own and from other objects. Devices like pendulums and structures like slopes can greatly influence how the candy moves. Om Nom himself can also be moved around based on the environment. There will also be dangers like pitfalls and destructive obstacles that can eliminate the candy and force you to redo the level.

The biggest addition is the Nommies which are creatures similar to Om Nom but have special abilities. They can help Om Nom on contact or by being tapped with each one serving a specific purpose. You can also earn coins through playing which can be spent on one of four power-ups: Bombs to explode and move things with force, Balloons to lift things up, Teleporters to move things around, and Hints to provide guidance.

Tips and Tricks

Although there are some levels that require you to react a bit faster, a majority of them allow you to go at your own pace. Examine the level, see how the different elements can interact with each other, and then make your move.

Cut The Rope 2 Nommies

The Nommies are both new characters and new mechanics that have been introduced to the gameplay. There are 7 in total.

  • Rotos - Flying helicopter creatures that can carry Om Nom and candy from one spot to another.
  • Lick - A creature with a long tongue that can be used to make bridges.
  • Blue - A blocky being that can produce multiple copies of itself to make stacks and move things around.
  • Toss - A creature with a spring on its head that can launch Om Nom to new heights.
  • Boo - A scary creature that will scare Om Nom and cause him to jump back.
  • Snailbrow - A one-eyed Snail that will move things around but can be stopped by tapping.
  • Ginger - A living fireball that will burn certain objects on contact.

Game Details

  • Developer: ZeptoLab
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile), iOS, and Android
  • Languages: English

Gameplay Footage

FAQs

Is Cut The Rope 2 free?

While the game is free to download and play on all of its available platforms, the app versions offer in-game purchases. Most are optional, but the game runs on energy and if that runs out, you either need to wait or pay to restore it.

title: Shell Shockers
detail:
There will always be room for an online competitive game that throws you into a randomized fray with other players. Shell Shockers is one such game where eggs are fighting it out to be the top. It's a 3D FPS game where your goal changes based on the game mode, but you'll always be an egg with a number of weapons to unleash. It's fast-paced and chaotic so it might take a few rounds to get cracking.

How to Play Shell Shockers

Shell Shockers is a first-person shooter with sharp and quick controls to keep up with the action. It offers two control schemes in the mouse and keyboard or controller. If you go with the former, the default controls are as follows:

  • W: Move Forward
  • S: Move Backward
  • A: Move Left
  • D: Move Right
  • Spacebar: Jump
  • F: Melee Attack
  • Left Mouse Button: Fire
  • Shift: Precise Aim
  • R: Reload
  • E: Swap Weapon
  • Q: Throw Grenade

The default controls for an Xbox-style controller are:

  • Left Directional Stick: Move
  • Right Directional Stick: Aim
  • A: Jump
  • RT: Fire
  • LT: Precise Aim
  • X: Reload
  • Y: Swap Weapon
  • RB: Throw Grenade
  • B: Melee Attack

Arm your Egg in Shell Shockers

Being a fast-paced online game, Shell Shockers offers options in order to help you stand out among the crowd. Before jumping into the game, you can customize your egg from the Lobby. By clicking on Inventory, you can customize your egg with different types of colors, markings, and hats. You can also choose its main weapon, secondary weapon, grenade, and melee weapon.

Only the main weapon has different options in terms of performance while the other items are purely aesthetic. If you're unhappy with your main weapon choice during a match, you can swap it out at the Respawn screen. These are the currently available main weapons as described by Shell Shockers:

  • EGGK-47: "The classic, high rate of fire, medium range, never jams."
  • Scrambler: "2 shots - Shotgun blasts do critical damage up close."
  • Free Ranger: "Semi Automatic Sniper - Destroy from a distance."
  • RPEGG: "Small magazine, medium distance. Big damage!"
  • Whipper: "Large clip full of egg cracking bullets. Close to medium range."
  • Crackshot: "Bolt Action Sniper - One-shot stopping power."
  • Tri-Hard: "3-round burst, accurate, medium-range specialist."

If you'd like to unlock more items, you need to play matches to earn Eggs which are in-game currency. You can also buy more Eggs and items directly using a credit card. Additionally, watching ad videos will net you Eggs as well.

Shell Shockers Game Modes

Shell Shockers offers varied gameplay with four different game modes. You can choose one of the following from the menu at the bottom of the Lobby:

  • Captula the Spatula: The game's version of Capture the Flag. Look for the enemy's Spatula, grab it, and bring it back to your base. The one with the most captures wins.
  • Teams: Players are sorted into teams to fight against each other. The team with the most points wins.
  • Free For All: Every egg for itself! Do your best to crack as many eggs as you can.
  • King of the Coop: The game's version of King of the Hill. Fight to hold your spot in the coop for as long as possible.

Game Details

  • Release Date: 2017-09-01 (published on GamePix, 2019-12-22)
  • Developer: Blue Wizard Digital
  • Platforms: Web Browser, iOS, and Android Devices
  • Languages: English, French, German, Russian, Spanish, Portuguese, Korean, Chinese, and Dutch.
  • Last Update: 2021-03-24

Shell Shockers Gameplay Trailer

FAQ

How to create private games in Shell Shockers?

Is Shell Shockers safe?

Shell Shockers is considered a safe game overall. While it does involve guns as part of the gameplay, the setting is cartoon-like and there is no depiction of realistic gun violence. The game provides a fun and light-hearted experience without promoting any harmful or dangerous behaviors. Players can enjoy the game without being exposed to graphic or inappropriate content, making it a suitable choice for a wide range of audiences.

title: Dogeminer
detail:
There can be a mystery surrounding where certain memes come from, but a lot of credit can be given to cute animals like the Shiba Inu of Dogeminer. As the original dogecoin game, it's your job to get as many dogecoins as possible. Likely inspired by the trend of mining digital currency over long periods of time, this game is very deliberate in having you do the lion's share of the work in order to get as many dogecoins as you can. Only then, can you reach the Shiba's dream of buying all the things you need in order to get to the Moon.

About Dogeminer

As far as meme games go, this one is pretty simple and solid. It's an idle tapping game that's based around internet humor but it's not too invasive. You'll get popups of poor grammar while all the images and graphics look like they were ripped from different memes. It's a harmless activity to get you busy similar to games like Cookie Clicker. You can get into a rhythm of clicking and buying which will amass you a large number of coins while you're lost in thought. Though, considering the clear and minimal visuals, there won't be too much to distract you from what you're doing.

How to Play

The original Dogeminer is restricted to just the mouse which can is convenient. You click on the rock where the big Shiba Inu is to mine coins with the number of coins mined based on how fast and how much you click. You can also navigate the menu on the right side in order to hire helpers and facilities to automatically mine coins for you. There's also an upgrade menu to improve the pickaxe of the main Shiba and your helpers/facilities which increases how many coins they can mine at once.

The goal is to mine enough coins to afford a Rocket Ship to the Moon. Despite the introduction, the true price of the Rocket is only 100,000 dogecoins. Once you get to the moon, you can have two mining operations going at the same time. At this point, the goal becomes trying mine enough dogecoins to get to other planets and eventually afford the Time Machine which supposedly takes you to infinite dogecoin. This means you'll need to mine 999,999,999 dogecoins.

Tips and Tricks

The best way to start is to start strong by clicking as much as you can to build up enough reserve to buy a lot of helpers/facilities at once. You should hold the mouse in place in one hand and then mash the left mouse button with your dominant hand. This is also a game that benefits you to forget that it's running.

Game Details

  • Developer: rkn_dev
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile) and Android
  • Languages: English

Gameplay Footage

FAQs

What happened to the first Dogeminer?

The first Dogeminer is still available to play on PC and Android devices, but it is often overlooked due to the release of Dogeminer 2 which is considered the refined and updated version.

Is Dogecoin real and worth it?

Although initially created as a joke, Dogecoin has become a valid cryptocurrency that current calculations consider profitable.

title: Smash Karts
detail:
There are many takes on the concept of racing, but the go-kart style is quite popular in terms of more humorous and colorful scenarios. You can get a sense of this if you play a few rounds of Smash Karts. This wacky 3D kart game is all about driving around arenas and trying to smash the other karts with creative driving and a heavy arsenal.

Updates December 2024: Smash Karts Season 11: Snow Drift

In the world of Smash Karts, a magical frost blankets the arenas, transforming them into glistening winter landscapes. So warm up by the fire, enjoy your eggnog, and get ready—because a flurry of exciting new content is on its way!

Welcome to Season 11: Snow Drift!

This Winter Season, Smash Karts invites you to explore a captivating winter wonderland filled with surprises. From an icy new arena to frosty fresh characters and a thrilling new weapon, this holiday season is packed with everything you’ve been wishing for.

Updates: 2.3.0 Smash Karts Season 4: Dead End

Just in time for the spookiest part of the year, Smash Karts unleashes its Season 4 update, aptly titled "Dead End." Players can look forward to a terrifyingly fun array of new characters, from the Grim Reaper to Slimey and Pennywinkle. This season introduces the "Spooky Spinner," a mechanic guaranteed to dish out all-new Halloween-themed prizes every time you give it a spin. For those craving more intense action, the update offers a new max player feature, supporting 1v1 battles and extending the arena player count to an explosive 24 participants, although this feature is currently limited to private rooms. The hauntingly spectacular "Smash Stations" arena transports your battles to an intergalactic plane. Additional novelties include creepy kart colors, chilling toppers, a variety of hats, and spine-tingling celebrations. Prepare for a frightful season filled with smashing and scares!

How to play Smash Karts

Smash Karts is a driving game that has delegated most of the complex mechanics of driving to only a few buttons. It's compatible with both the keyboard and Xbox-style controller. These are the controls for both types:

Keyboard Controls

  • W/Up Arrow: Move Forward
  • A/Left Arrow: Turn Left
  • D/Right Arrow: Turn Right
  • S/Down Arrow: Brake/Reverse
  • Spacebar: Use Weapon

X-Style Controls

  • Left Analog: Turning
  • RT: Accelerate
  • LT: Brake
  • A: Use Weapon

The goal of Smash Karts is dependent on the Game Mode, but the classic is Free For All. Simply put, drive into Loot Boxes to get weapons and then use them to eliminate the other karts. Your own health, time, and ranking are displayed at the top of the screen. Your current weapon will be displayed in the lower right corner.

Smash Karts Weapons

A key collectible in Smash Karts is weapons. You will get these by driving into Loot Boxes scattered around the arena. You can only have one weapon at a time, and you can't replace your current weapon until it's been used. There are three types of weapons:

  • Offensive: These weapons are projectiles that can be launched from a distance
  • Defensive: These weapons generate a force that protects your kart while damaging others
  • Traps: These are weapons that can be strategically placed around the arena for other karts to drive into

Smash Karts Game Modes

The base mode in Smash Karts is Deathmatch, but you can unlock others by playing more matches and leveling up. The current available Game Modes are the following:

  • Gem Collector Collect the most gems to win
  • Hat Holder: Get the hat and wear it for as long as you can
  • Capture the Flag: Grab the enemy flag and bring it back to your base
  • Teams: Teams of karts go all out
  • Score Target: The first to score the select amount of points wins
  • Time Limit: Get the most points in a certain amount of time

Customize your Driver and Match in Smash Karts

Being an online game, Smash Karts offers options in terms of customizing your player characters and even allowing you to host your own match. To change your driver's head, kart, and/or hats, just click on Customize on the left side of the screen. To create your own match, click Create underneath the Play button and then choose the settings for your game.

title: 10x10!
detail:
Many things puzzle us and we never know when the next solution will present itself so we've got to figure it out ourselves like in 10x10. At some point or another, everything comes back to math which is arguably the purest form of science. Knowing even a little bit of math can help you in the most unexpected ways like with solving puzzles. Tetris may have been about blocks, but it was also about geometry and angles which are mathematical. Here's another puzzling scenario where you have a bit more time to think, but that also means that you need to be more creative with your answers.

About 10x10

Video games could not exist without math which is why there are so many games that base their entire premise around numbers. While this game may not be super number-heavy, math is involved and you'll figure that out soon enough. You need to think about all the spaces, and your available blocks and plan so that you can keep playing. The answer won't always be clear and you need to determine what will be the best course of action at the moment and for the future. It all comes down to problem-solving and thinking carefully about the data at hand.

How to Play

10x10 is a 2D puzzle game about slotting different arrangements of blocks into a 10 by 10 grid using the mouse. To move blocks into place, select them from the bottom of the screen, click and hold the Left Mouse Button, and then drag them onto the grid. If they fit, they'll slot right into the space. The goal is to get the highest score possible by completing columns and rows of 10 blocks.

When a column or row is filled, the blocks in it will vanish and fill up more space. If the blocks were part of the arrangement, the ones not in the column or row would be left behind. You get a selection of three block arrangements underneath the grid that will be randomized. You won't get any new blocks until the ones you have are placed onto the grid. You can touch the edges of the grid without any problems, but if you reach a point where you can't fit any of your current blocks in… that's game over. You'll get the chance to go back three moves if you wish or you can choose to start over from the beginning.

Tips and Tricks

This is a more contained and slower-paced form of Tetris which means you have no pressure to rush through. The blocks you may get are random, but your arrangements should always try to take up the least amount of space. Start at the edges and keep the center clear for as long as you can.

Game Details

  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

Does 10x10 have an ending?

This is a game that's all about trying to keep it going for as long as possible so the game only ends when you can't make any more moves.

title: Funny Battle Simulator 2
detail:
When we learn about historical battles or read about fictional battles, we may wonder how things might have turned out under circumstances like those in Funny Battle Simulator 2. Battles on a grand scale are rarely ever a good thing but that's not why you've picked up this simulator. You want to see how a battle might play out between warriors from completely different periods or how it might go if certain animals had been tamed for battling. Not all of your questions and curiosities will be answered, but this can open the door to new ones and even provide some information you didn't know you needed.

About Funny Battle Simulator 2

Games all about large-scale battles and wars are common, but simulators about them are not as they're a lot like toys. This game is a toy where you can have it play out some aspects of your imagination when you try to picture certain forces fighting each other. There is some strategy involved when it comes to balancing and dealing with the terrain, but these can easily be overlooked when you start placing random units in random places just so that you can see their ragdoll forms charge into an impossible battle. No matter which side ends up winning, you'll end up learning something.

How to Play

Funny Battle Simulator 2 is a 3D simulator game about conquering a fictional army with your own fictional forces using the mouse. The WASD keys can be used to move the camera around so that you can get a better look at the layout, but your cursor is used to select units from the menu at the bottom of the screen and then choose their placement. To pick a unit, click on its icon with the Left Mouse Button and then click again on an open part of your side of the field to deploy it. The goal of each level is to defeat all the enemies in the opposing army.

When you're planning your army, look at the amount of funds you have at the top of the screen and to the right. As long as you stay below that number, you can deploy as many units. However, also keep in mind that you're limited to a certain number of units, shown above the funds, but know that every unit type only counts as one. When you've placed all your units, start the battle and your army will advance and attack the enemy once they're in range.

Note that the different terrain can also play a part in your strategy. There are three types: Desert, Tundra, and Grasslands. Desert will slow down units, Tundra will speed them up, and Grasslands will hide them from ranged attackers. The level ends when one side loses all of its units.

Tips and Tricks

Take your time to examine the enemy forces and figure out which side is the most vulnerable to attack. If they have ranged units, find a way to counter them or they'll chip away at your forces from a safe distance. Large units are powerful but have limited mobility and are much bigger targets.

Game Details

  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English and Russian

Can I unlock more units in Funny Battle Simulator 2?

From the start, a majority of the units from the different categories are already unlocked, but you can unlock an additional unit for each by watching ads.

title: Body Drop 3d
detail:
When ragdoll physics came into play, video games became much more hilarious, and titles like Body Drop 3D base their whole gameplay around it. The main character appears to be a crash test dummy who is ready to take any test like a champ. They will place themselves on a number of different levels with various obstacles and structures in which to interact. Unfortunately for the dummy, how they interact with the world around them is up to you and they're not a crash test dummy for no reason. You get to test just how resilient they are as they get back up time and time again.

About Body Drop 3D

While crash test dummies may have disappeared from much of the media in recent years, they're still quite popular in video games. Considering that their job is to endure dangerous situations which can include impact, they serve a very useful purpose in providing an outlet for frustration. The dummy will get back up as many times as you need them to be ready to take on your punishment like a champ. It's easy to get carried away with the scenarios and you can earn points quickly to unlock new ones and see just how creative you can be with your aim.

How to Play

Body Drop 3D is a ragdoll game where you are using tools to interact with the crash test dummy. The controls are all connected to the mouse and you'll get the hang of it quickly.

Controls

  • Move Cursor - Aim
  • Left Mouse Button - Fire Ball
  • (Hold) Right Mouse Button and move Cursor - Change Camera Angle

Each level has the dummy standing at a certain starting point, and you can throw balls at them to make them fall. You only get three balls with the goal being to use them to cause the dummy to fall in such a way that they take max damage. You can see the amount of damage you're doing on the dummy diagram to the left of the screen. As areas become more damaged, they'll become more red. If bones break, they'll appear in relevant read body parts. The goal is to break as many bones as possible to earn points.

Tips and Tricks

Despite the ragdoll nature of the game, there is a degree of strategy to it. You only get three balls to shoot and the dummy is sturdier than they may seem. As such, you should aim the balls at their head or legs to have the best chance to make them lose their balance. Scan the surroundings so that you can aim to have the dummy fall as far as possible while hitting as many obstacles on the way down.

Game Details

  • Developer: JustPlay
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile) and Android
  • Languages: English, and Russian

Gameplay Footage

FAQs

What is a body drop?

Though Body Drop 3D is literally about causing a body to drop down, body drop also refers to a Judo technique used to throw an opponent so they end up on their back.

title: Narrow One
detail:
Although the modern era offers a lot of conveniences that we'd be hard-pressed to give up, it can be exciting to experience the past through games like Narrow One. This is a competitive online multiplayer game where everyone is an archer. This is the pinnacle of ranged fighting at the time and every shot needs to count because you can only hold so many arrows at once. The game moves fast with kills and deaths coming just as fast. It may take some time to get used to the movement and arcs of the arrows, but you'll have to if you want your opponents to get the point.

About Narrow One

There's quite a collection of medieval multiplayer games and they're all realistically clunky just like you'd expect such combat to be. As such, this game is quite refreshing since everything moves quickly as archers are supposed to on the field of battle. The fields are large with a variety of structures, levels, and vantage points to navigate and line up shots. There are subtleties to master in order to become the best archer you can be. It's easy to jump into a game so practice as much as you want to sharpen your eyes and arrows so that you can properly take a bow.

How to Play

Narrow One is FPS with bows and arrows controlled via the mouse and keyboard.

Controls

  • W/Up Arrow - Move Forward
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Backward
  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right
  • Mouse Cursor - Aim
  • Left Mouse Button - Fire/Attack
  • Q - Switch Weapons

The game only has one current mode which is Capture the Flag. As part of the blue or red team, your goal is to get the enemy flag at the opposite end of the map and carry it back to your flag to score a point. The first team to score three points wins.

Tips and Tricks

This is a very quick and sharp game with a lot of short movement and precise turns to take some time to adjust to the response time. Since most of the bows are standard, practice shots to see how arrows fly and drop off. Crossbows have much straighter shots but tend to have much longer reload times.

Narrow One Archers

The game offers you six types of archers to play as, each with its own distinct ranged weapon.

  • Scout - A fast-moving archer equipped with a short-range bow that can shoot up to three arrows in quick succession.
  • Assault - An archer made for attacking equipped with a heavy bow that fires a strong arrow at medium range.
  • Sharpshooter - A precision archer equipped with a long bow that has a scope made to take out enemies from a distance.
  • Runner - A mobile archer equipped with a quick-firing one-handed crossbow.
  • Support - An artillery archer that can back up the team with a heavy crossbow that fires a volley of arrows.
  • Defense - A sturdy archer with a two-handed crossbow and solid damage output.

Customizing Your Archer

By playing through the game and earning coins or watching in-game ads, you can visit the store on the Main Menu to buy gear for your archer to change their appearance and stats. There are multiple aspects you can change about your archers.

  • Looks - Changes how the archer looks, doesn't affect stats.
  • Gear - Changes the armor your archer is wearing, and affects stats like defense and movement.
  • Bow - Changes the archer's bow affecting stats like range.
  • Arrow - Changes the arrows your archer uses affecting stats like damage output.
  • Melee - Changes your archer's melee weapon affecting their damage, range, and attack speed.

Narrow One Maps

The game Capture the Flag can be played across one of sixteen different maps.

  • Castles - Each team has a large stone castle to defend.
  • Forts - Each team has a large wooden fort to defend.
  • Alleys - Teams fight through the backstreets of a medieval city.
  • Fields - Teams fight in the fields throughout a farming village.
  • Ruins - Teams fight across bridges and ruined structures surrounded by water.
  • Arena - Teams fight in a large and enclosed battle arena.
  • Towers - Teams fight between two tall and connected towers.
  • Arch - Teams fight throughout what appears to be an Eastern-style temple.
  • Halls - Teams fight through large open castle halls.
  • Tombs - Teams fight in a complex system of underground catacombs.
  • Hills - Teams fight over lush and open green hills.
  • Jungle - Teams fight through dense and thick vegetation.
  • Wall - Teams fight across what appears to be the Great Wall.
  • Temple - Teams fight through what looks to be an ancient temple.
  • Graveyard - A dark and foggy map where teams fight among graves and structures.
  • Desert - Teams fight across sandy plains filled with various structures.

Game Details

title: Ultimate Hero Clash 2
detail:
The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles and Power Rangers have some things in common, like how they're both teams and they're both in Ultimate Hero Clash 2. Even though these two groups have never had a reason to cross paths in the past, now they're doing so for one very obvious reason: They want to find out who's stronger. And it's not just the heroes that are getting involved, but it's also the villains too. Each side wants to prove that their universe is the best by being the best fighter and you're picking sides. Fight for fun, justice, and crossover appreciation!

About Ultimate Hero Clash 2

Crossover fighting games range all over the place but they tend to be a way for some people to live out certain arguments that they have. This game may finally answer the question of who has the tougher universe, the TMNT or Power Rangers. Each group has its own strengths and weaknesses which the game tries to convey through their moves and stats, but it's all about experimentation. You may find a synergy you never knew you could have with a certain character than one you really cherish. It's about fighting it out with all kinds of teams and seeing which ones play best for you.

How to Play

Ultimate Hero Clash 2 is a 2.5D fighting game about the TMNT and Power Ranger world colliding using the keyboard.

Controls

  • Up Arrow - Jump
  • Down Arrow - Block
  • Left Arrow - Move Left (double tap to Dash)
  • Right Arrow - Move Right (double tap to Dash)
  • Z/X - Attack (Press both for spin)
  • Spacebar - Use Special

The goal is to defeat your opponent as quickly and hopefully with as little injury as possible. Most modes let you choose up to four fighters to have on your team. When a fighter falls, the next member of the team will step in. Only when all of a team's fighters are defeated does the match end.

You'll have a huge roster of characters to choose from on both sides, including the main characters, supporting characters, and enemies. When you've chosen your team, you'll be able to select a stage and then the fight will start. The health bars will be displayed at the top of the screen with your fighter being on the right. All of the attacks have a colorful arc to them and will deal damage on contact. The special meter below your health bar will build up over time and then you can unleash a powerful special attack.

Tips and Tricks

Your opponents can try to be aggressive and engage you quickly so you need to be careful to not get trapped in a corner. If this happens, you can try to use a spin attack to break out. Use attacks to keep your opponents back and use the Special to break their rhythm.

Ultimate Hero Clash 2 Game Modes

The game currently offers four different modes to try:

  • Quick Match - Select a team and jump into a quick fight!
  • Arcade - Beat a series of fights with your team.
  • Vs Battle - Enter a one-on-one fight.
  • Outlast - See how long your team can last before being taken down!

Game Details

  • Developer: Nickelodeon Games
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

Gameplay Footage

Does Ultimate Hero Clash 2 have online multiplayer?

The game does clearly have a Vs Mode on the menu screen, but this is just so that you can have one fighter going solo against a computer fighter.

title: Call Of Tanks
detail:
In games where you get to ride in vehicles, you can only hope that the selection will include some kind of tank like the ones you command in Call of Tanks. You'll find yourself in command of a small base in a desert region where you're trying to hold control of a territory. Of course, there are other bases also trying to take over and are just as determined as you. It's an isometric real-time strategy game where you have to send teams of drivers of various vehicles in order to take the fight to the enemy base while defending your own in order to claim victory.

About Call of Tanks

Despite how popular takes are in popular media, especially in video games, there's not much that we know about them. The average person would probably be unlikely to name one kind of tank, but this game can definitely teach you something about them. You have quite a large roster of tanks and other vehicles that you can see how they work in tandem. This is where the strategy comes into place because vehicles are costly and you don't want to blow all your cash on spamming the same tank. You'll see quickly how a balanced force is the key to victory.

How to Play

Call of Tanks is a real-time strategy game with zoomed-out view that allows you to make decisions from afar with the mouse as you survey with the keyboard.

Controls

  • Mouse Cursor - Navigate Menus
  • Left Mouse Button - Make Selection
  • Mousewheel - Change Altitude
  • Right Mouse Button (hold) - Change Angle
  • W/Up Arrow - Pan Camera Up
  • S/Down Arrow - Pan Camera Down
  • A/Left Arrow - Pan Camera Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Pan Camera Right

While many battles are fought with soldiers, here you'll be fighting exclusively with vehicles. Each level puts your base on side and the enemy base opposite it. You fight by selecting vehicles to spawn from the menu in the lower right corner. To place them on the field, click and then drag the selected vehicle into the spawn are in front of your base. Each vehicle costs money and your total amount is tracked above the vehicle menu.

The vehicles will then automatically make their way to the enemy base, attacking any enemies they encounter. While in the enemy base, your vehicles will attack until its structures until its destroyed or they are. You'll win once the enemy Command Center is destroyed and lose if your own is destroyed.

Tips and Tricks

It may be tempting to just spam the strongest tanks you have, but your finances are quite limited so spend wisely. You should also adjust your strategy based on what the mission parameters are, some having harsh restrictions. Also, try to spawn vehicles as close together as possible so that they support each other and attack more effectively.

Call of Tanks Upgrades

You'll earn Metal as you complete missions which can be used to buy upgrades for your tanks, defenses, and eventually whole bases.

Tanks

  • Humvee - A cheap, light, and fast-moving vehicle.
  • APC - An armored but still mobile and affordable vehicle.
  • Rhino - A backbone tank with decent firepower and armor.
  • Mammoth - A massive and destructive tank.
  • Ambulance - A support vehicle that helps repair other units.
  • Suicide Truck - A fast-moving vehicle full of explosives meant to hit once and hard.
  • Radar - A support device meant to help vehicles with tracking.
  • Bell - A small and fast-moving helicopter.
  • Apache - An armored attack helicopter equipped with heavy weapons.

Defense

  • Tower - Tall structures made to attack all sorts of vehicles.
  • AT Gun - Grounded weapons made to do heavy damage.
  • Air Defense - Missile launchers designed to quickly eliminate air units.
  • Command Center - The base nerve center which generates most of the income.
  • Barracks - A support structure that provides additional income.
  • Helipad - A place for air units that provides additional income.

Bases

  • Keep - A starter base with minimal defenses.
  • Castle - A fortified base with additional defenses.
  • Stronghold - A tough and expanded base with stronger counterattacks.
  • Empire - The largest and toughest base with max defenses.

Game Details

  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile) and Android
  • Languages: English

On all of its available platforms, the game is free to play and download. However, there are in-game options to purchase more Metal if need be.

title: Merge Cannon: Chicken Defense
detail:
Chickens are quite low on the food chain and the overall chain so it's understandable if they want to take revenge and you need to be ready for it in Merge Cannon: Chicken Defense. This world is natural and lush which means that the chickens are going to work hard to take it back. They're amassing a huge force to stomp all over you, but you've had time to build up your defenses so there's still a chance to push them back. You've got a wall and tons of firepower to put to use and strengthen your side to keep from getting roasted.

About Merge Cannon: Chicken Defense

There have been attempts to make chickens a big threat and it can be pulled off well providing an unexpected challenge. This game is all about chickens being a dangerous force and it still works with the comical and stylized presentation. There's not much to worry about in terms of mechanics which allows you to focus on what you're seeing and doing. The chicken forces tend to spread out evenly to give you a better chance, but it's up to you to actually come up with a winning strategy to defeat the waves. Who's the real chicken?

How to Play

Merge Cannon: Chicken Defense is a 2D tower-defense game about fighting back an army of chickens using cannons and the mouse. You use the cursor to navigate the UI and the Left Mouse Button to click and interact with elements. To move a cannon, click, hold, and then drag it to where you want it. The goal is to push back waves of chickens which will get larger and stronger as time passes.

Your main defense is a grey castle wall that you need to protect at all costs. To fight back, you'll have access to cannons. The cannons work interestingly in that to unlock new cannon models, you need to merge similar models. A cannon's level is clearly indicated by a blue banner. Drag a cannon onto another cannon of the same level to turn it into a new cannon of one level higher. You can do this as long as you have cannons that share the same levels. Cannons on the field will be your reserves, while cannons along the wall will actively attack chickens once they're in range.

At the bottom of the screen, you can track the castle wall health, your money, available cannons, cannon drops, and the store. When the cannon drop crate meter fills up, a crate will appear in your reserve field containing a cannon. You can also buy additional cannons as long as you have space in your reserve. If the castle wall gets too damaged, you can spend gold earned from slaying chickens to repair and strengthen it. Cannons cannot be combined with others that aren't their level so if you want to remove one, drag it to the trashcan in the bottom right corner.

Tips and Tricks

This is a defense game where you need to be active and constantly making changes. Always ensure that your castle wall slots are filled as you can combine cannons at any time. If you fail, simply retry as the current wave will preserve your current setup and assets at the time of defeat.

  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

title: Dogeminer 2
detail:
If you're online, it's nearly impossible to escape the flood of memes you'll encounter and some have turned them into games, like in the Dogeminer series. Yes, the famous Shhiba Inu who became popular due to their expressions and moniker of "Doge" has their own line of games for you to play. This is an idle affair as you try to get your paws on as many coins as possible. The more coins you get, the more resources you can afford to get even more cash. This may be a game that goes on forever but it's at least an activity to keep you busy with constant ways to expand.

About Dogeminer 2

The sequel to the original Dogeminer seems to have done what the sequel usually does: Keep the core the same but change some of the elements around it. There are some familiar graphics to cling to with a gallery of new assets to appreciate and add to your mining operation. Whether you're active or idle, the collection of silly realistic meme graphics can be an amusing sight to peek at every now and then. You might be tempted to try your hand at actual coin mining but it's nowhere near as easy or silly as this game makes it seem.

How to Play

Dogeminer 2 is a game made to play itself once you get the right elements set up. It's all controlled with the mouse and keyboard with minimal buttons to master.

Controls

  • Mouse Cursor - Navigate UI and Mining Space
  • Left Mouse Button/Spacebar - Mine Coins
  • Mouse Cursor and Left Mouse Button - Collect Coin Piles

The goal of the game is to mine a currency known as Dogecoin. The reason Shiba Inu is mining these coins is in order to fund a rocket to go to the moon. The game starts with the lead doge mining a constantly respawning piece of rock. By clicking it or tapping, the doge will mine it producing coins with every swing. As you earn more coins, you can use them to buy elements to aid your mining operations. On the right side is both the Shop and Upgrade Menus. The former lets you pay workers and facilities to mine coins for you, while the latter lets you improve their performance. Once you can afford the rocket, you can head to the Moon to start mining operations there.

Tips and Tricks

It may be tempting to spend coins as soon as you get them but you might want to hold off for a little bit. The main miner is the highest coin earner you have and they're dependent on your input. Mash that mining button to build a nice reserve and then go on a spending spree. Also, collect the coin piles as they appear since they will disappear after a few seconds.

Dogeminer 2 Items

While playing the game, you'll come across a number of different items that all have special purposes.

  • Dogecoin - The main currency which is used to buy everything.
  • Dogediamond - A special jewel that can be used to buy upgrades, saving you coins.
  • Pickaxe - The main tool of the main miner which improves their mining output.
  • Containers - These packages can have coins, pickaxes, or loot to aid your mining.
  • Loot - A variety of items that have passive effects on your mining.
  • Special Coins - Get these coins to add a strong and temporary boost to your coin earning.

  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

As it currently stands, the game is free-to-play online and even uses a cloud-save feature so that you can maintain your progress by setting up an account.

title: Hero 4: Slice Enemies
detail:
There are many qualities that make a hero, but one can only wonder which of them applies to the main character of Hero 4: Slice Enemies. You are apparently a yellow entity covered in spikes running through a small town in the middle of nowhere. The problem is that it is populated by aggressive blue figures equipped with a variety of weapons out for your blood. This is a 3D hack-and-slash game where you need to cut your way through these enemies in order to stay safe and maybe make the town safer as a result. One can only hope that the context makes your actions heroic.

About Hero 4

The main reason people play games is to unwind and relax and sometimes let loose on some digital targets. This game facilitates that in a pretty visceral way. In a way, the game covers the most physical aspects of a standard action movie. That means you can get down to business as soon as you boot up the game. With such an overpowered character, you'll feel unstoppable as you cut through crowds of armed blue soldiers and the occasional giant. Just try to have a little bit of finesse in your wild swinging and jumping.

How to Play

Hero 4 is a hack-and-slash game that is very easily played with the keyboard and mouse. Make sure you get used to the somewhat stilted movements.

Controls

  • Mouse Cursor - Look Around
  • Left Mouse Button - Attack/Throw Enemy
  • Right Mouse Button - Leap Attack
  • Mousewheel - Spin Attack
  • W/Up Arrow - Move Forward
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Backward
  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right
  • Shift - Sprint
  • Spacebar - Jump
  • F - Grab Enemy

As the Hero of the story, you need to live up to the expectation of slicing. Each level puts you into an open small-town environment whereupon enemies will spawn from all sides and lock onto your location. Your goal is to use your attacks to cut through all the enemies until you've cleared out the town, with the number of enemies being counted in the top left corner of the screen. Once you've sliced them all, you can move on to the next level. Your health is indicated by a heart in the bottom left corner and if it empties, you'll need to try the level again.

Tips and Tricks

The hero may be very tough, but he's not invincible so make sure you stay mobile. Enemies will come in ways of melee attacks that will surround you while ranged enemies attack from afar. To avoid draining your health too quickly, use the spin and leap attacks to break out of crowds and focus on taking out the ranged attackers first.

Game Details

  • Developer: GoGoMan
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English and Russian

What is the main character in Hero 4?

Though much of the story of the game is up to interpretation, it's believed that the hero is an altered beng who is fighting against military forces. With the character's appearance and power, there are parallels between this game and the Prototype game series.

title: Hero 5: Katana Slice
detail:
Many things can define a hero, but they're often wielding a sword and fighting against many other guys with swords like in Hero 5: Katana Slice. This is another foray into the SUPERHOT-like dimension where all the figures have very angular polygonal forms. The big change is that instead of running naked, the fighters have learned to wear armor. Thankfully the hero of the hour has also donned himself in armor and taken up a sword, but stands alone against the armies. He must rely only on your skills and control to cut through all the waves of enemies that are trying to hunt him down for one reason or another.

About Hero 5: Katana Slice

The Hero series of games have tried different angles with every entry while still trying to keep the base elements intact. This game fits well into the series and has you returning to a melee style of combat. Because you're more at risk of getting injured, the movement has been expanded to allow you to leap and speed around. The maps are also much bigger giving you more space to explore and chances to regroup against difficult enemies. It's one of the bigger entries in the series and you may find yourself exploring more than you expected to while sword-fighting around.

How to Play

Hero 5: Katana Slice is a 3D third-person hack-and-slash game about cutting through enemies using the mouse and keyboard.

Controls

  • Cursor - Look
  • Left Mouse Button - Slash
  • Right Mouse Button - Aim/Dash
  • W/Up Arrow - Move Forward
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Backward
  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right
  • Spacebar - Jump
  • Shift - Sprint

The goal is to eliminate all the enemies in the level. The number of enemies will be indicated in the top left corner of the screen. The map showing where enemies are located will be in the top right corner of the screen. Your health is indicated by a heart in the lower left corner and when it empties, it's game over.

When you start a level, you'll spawn in an open area of the map. Enemies will begin running toward you from different areas. Your only defense is to move around while swinging your sword to slice them to pieces. Enemies will come in melee, giant, and ranged variants. The first two will attempt to strike you with their weapons while the last will be throwing projectiles from various vantage points. By using the map, you can track where all the enemies who won't engage you are and hunt them down.

Tips and Tricks

This may be about swordsmen and sword-fighting but the enemies don't follow the laws of nature. Slicing them may cause their limbs and heads to fly off but don't consider them defeated until they go limp. If you get surrounded, jump somewhere out of reach and out of range to take a breather.

  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile) and Android
  • Languages: English and Russian

title: Knifeblades.io
detail:
Weapons of all kinds have been the trademark of numerous heroes and villains, but Knifeblades io turns the weapons themselves into the hero. This is a universe apparently dominated by circular entities with big facial expressions that maintain a strong but personal gravitational field. This seems to be their main way of interacting with things and the main thing they want to interact with is knives. They participate in a gladiator-style event where they must grab knives in an arena and turn them into a field of death around them. This is the only way they can cut through the competition and be the best.

About Knifeblades io

Almost every type of io game has a competitive focus with every other player you encounter being a potential rival. This game makes it pretty obvious since you surround yourself with knives while other players surround themselves with knives. It's kind of satisfying to float around and collect the scattered knives and watch your arsenal grow. When it comes to conflict, there's no tactics or trickery, it's just about pure power. There's something primal in that that reaches deep into the brain and makes you want to keep going so that you can feed it with more victories and see your circle transform.

How to Play

Knifeblades io is a 2D top-down game that uses swipe controls that are emulated by the mouse. Use the cursor to navigate the lobby menu in order to buy and combine knives. When you're in the arena, click the Left Mouse Button and then drag the mouse to move your knife circle around. The goal is to be the last one standing by eliminating the other players.

Your circle starts with five knives that constantly rotate around its body. As you explore the arena, you can collect loose knives to add to your own and increase your offense and defense. When you encounter a player, you need to clash with them by tearing through their knives with your own until you can hit their center. Upon doing so, the player will be eliminated and all their knives will scatter allowing you to collect them.

Clashing is powerful but also puts you at risk. You can use your knives to create a defensive formation by staying still, but you'll lose knives one at at a time as you maintain it. Be careful as there are also solid barriers scattered around the arena that will quickly knock away your knives on contact. The game ends when there's only one player left.

Through waiting, claiming rewards from the left side of the screen, and playing, you'll earn coins. This can be spent on Knives in the lobby menu by clicking on the icon at the bottom. Two of the same knives can be combined to form new knives. To equip, just click or drag them onto your circle. You'll also rank up as you play which will add new gameplay elements like moving obstacles.

Tips and Tricks

Like with other io games, the key thing is patience. Avoid other players for as long as possible and focus on improving your own power first. Once you feel confident, seek out players who are also on the move to clash with them easily.

Game Details

  • Developer: BPTop
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

Gameplay Footage

title: Dynamons World
detail:
Pokemon took the world by storm and sells millions of copies whenever it releases a new game and titles like Dynamons World have been inspired by it. Welcome to the wonderful Dynamons! Who or what is a Dynamons? Well, they're creatures that are intimately connected with nature and people do their best to study them, befriend them, capture them, tame them, and then make them fight. Only the best Dynamon trainer can train a Dynamon to be strong enough to defend itself and its allies. This is your chance to step up and be the hero of the Dynamon world!

About Dynamons World

Even if you've never played a Pokemon game, you've no doubt heard about them and can probably figure out the game mechanics at a glance. This game has a solid tutorial that teaches all the basics that you start applying immediately and set off on your adventure. While you can't explore every area as freely as you might like, there's still a lot to see and events are changing constantly. You'll never have to wander looking for a fight or new Dynamon as they'll be highlighted quite clearly so that you can jump right into the action. Train hard, fight hard, and go hard.

How to Play

Dynamons World is a 2D creature-collector game that you can play using only the mouse. You'll have several screens to interact with, including an overworld map showing different areas, and specific maps for each area with designated spots to visit. To visit one, simply move the cursor over to it and then click the Left Mouse Button. If there's an exclamation point or a person on it, it will trigger an event. In the menu, item, and battle screens, select the things you want using the cursor and Left Mouse Button. The goal is to become the best Dynamon trainer of all time like no one ever was.

After the tutorial, you can start visiting unlocked locations. Exclamation points indicate a wild Dynamon waiting for a fight. Dynamon will be associated with one of the following elements: Grass, Water, Fire, Light, and Dark. Each element counters another (Fire/Grass, Grass/Water, Water/Fire) but Light and Dark counter each other. You'll start with one Dynamon but can battle and capture weakened wild Dynamon with a Discatch. You can only have three Dynamon in your main party with six more in your reserves.

As Dynamons fight, they will earn EXP and when their EXP bar is full they can level up through the use of elemental stones. When they level up, they'll gain improved stats and may learn new skills to use in battle. If they level up enough, they can evolve into stronger forms. People who appear in areas represent rival trainers whom you can fight for rewards and greater EXP. When your Dynamon get hit, they'll take damage and if their HP bar drops to zero, they'll be knocked out. If you lose all of your Dynamon, you'll need to flee the fight. Don't worry though as Dynamon will heal fully in-between battles.

You'll also earn coins while fighting which can be spent at the shop. It uses a loot system so you'll never know what you'll get with each purchase.

Tips and Tricks

Even though your team is limited to three, try to have as much elemental coverage as possible. Get a feel for the different types of trainers so that you know which Dynamons to take into battle. Feel free to swap your Dynamon in and out so that they can all benefit from the EXP.

Game Details

title: Time Shooter 3: Swat
detail:
Time is a strange element of our universe that we don't fully understand, so we play around with it in titles like Time Shooter 3: SWAT. Taking place in a universe where time seems to be intrinsically connected to one individual and that's you. Don't think too hard about how you ended up with this power and the responsibilities associated with possessing it as you've likely been plugged into a simulated universe. It's a place where everyone seems to be after you and you need to become the hero of time… but not that one. It's time for some action.

About Time Shooter 3: SWAT

This isn't the first iteration of simulated time control adventures but it still needs to be handled carefully to make it fun. This game handles it well and makes you feel powerful once you realize exactly what's going on. The presentation allows you to detect danger and points of interest so that you can think carefully about each of your moves. It's sort of of interesting take on a strategy game where each movement can be treated as an action that both you and your enemies take at the same time. Again, as long as you don't think about it too much, you can get into it.

How to Play

Time Shooter 3: SWAT is a 3D first-person action game about defeating enemies and saving hostages using the mouse and keyboard.

Controls

  • Cursor - Look/Aim
  • Left Mouse Button - Fire/Attack/Interact
  • Right Mouse Button - Throw
  • W/Up Arrow - Move Forward
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Backward
  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right

The goal of each level is to eliminate all the enemies without harming any of the hostages. The enemies will be orange and hostages will be blue. Your health is indicated by three shields at the top of the screen. If you take three hits, you'll be defeated and have to start the level over.

When a level starts, you'll spawn in an open area where you'll be able to see enemies and weapons that you can use. Each weapon has a limited number of uses as indicated by a number at the bottom of the screen when you're holding it. Time only moves when you physically move from wherever you're standing. You can attack and throw things which will cause time to move extremely slowly. Enemies are more fragile than you and can be killed with a direct hit on an exposed part of their bodies.

Hostages are secured in rooms sealed with bright purple doors. The doors can be broken down with a weapon with enough power like a shotgun or a battering ram. You'll complete the level once all of the enemies have been defeated.

Tips and Tricks

Looking is free in this game, so take time to take a good look at your surroundings. Keep in mind that enemies can suddenly emerge from corners and alcoves hidden to the sides and behind you. Always take note of enemies that have ranged weapons and aim to put yourself in a position of cover or eliminate them first.

  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English, Turkish, and Russian

title: Hole.io
detail:
There's something so terrifying and yet intriguing about a hole and that mystery will deepen if you decide to play Hole IO. This is a strange realm that goes all over the place and has a very big problem: Holes. These aren't just holes that get bigger over time, but holes that are hungry to consume as much as they can. You will be controlling one of these holes as you compete with other holes to feed first and worry about size later. The bigger you are, the harder you'll be to fight, and that can only happen if you eat up everything… that's the hole story.

About Hole IO

What makes holes so interesting is the mystery that they provide, especially when you don't know how they can be. This game doesn't provide an answer to that but it doesn't need to do so. It's just a game about holes and the holes are moving and eating. You try and compete with the other holes or just focus on what you're doing to see how big you can get. To be the biggest hole is an accomplishment, but just seeing what it can eat is an even bigger one. Just make sure you don't get swallowed up too early otherwise you won't see how deep this game goes.

How to Play

Hole IO is a 3D top-down competitive game about holes swallowing everything using the mouse or keyboard.

Controls

  • W/Up Arrow - Move Up
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Down
  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right

With the mouse, simply mouse the cursor and your hole will move towards its location. The goal of the game involves eating enough for your hole to win.

The hole is attached to the ground and so is restricted to it on each map. When moving, the hole will not be stopped by any obstacles that it comes across. To "eat" something, you need to position the hole directly underneath it. A ring around the hole will indicate how close it is to growing and when it closes, the hole will increase in size. The hole can only eat objects that fit within its size, otherwise they will be unaffected save for some wobbling. In certain modes, holes can eat each other provided that they're big enough while most times they can just pass harmlessly through each other.

By playing the game and getting achievements, you can unlock new skins for your hole on the main menu. However, some skins can only be acquired through social media.

Tips and Tricks

When starting, you need to comb the edges of the map for small things like plants and bushes. Humans are also a good source, but they move and don't tend to group so stick to stationary objects like crates. A building can be eaten as long as you position yourself so that it falls straight down and not on its side.

Hole IO Game Modes

There are currently five modes available in the game:

  • Classic - Try to become the biggest hole in under 2 minutes!
  • Battle Royale - Eat to become the biggest hole and eat the others!
  • Team Vs. Team - Work with other holes to defeat the opposing holes.
  • Solo Run - Just you and a whole map to eat in 2 minutes!
  • Monsters Attack - Eat enough ammo to fire and defeat the monsters!

Game Details

  • Developer: QubicGames
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile), iOS, Android, and Switch
  • Languages: English

title: Hoop World
detail:
Basketball is one of the most popular and exciting sports based on how fast the players move, how fast the game keeps going, and the amazing tricks some players can pull off like in Hoop World. You are a huge basketball fan and not a bad player yourself, but you've developed your philosophy: The dunk is all that matters. You've spent time, energy, and most likely resources to train yourself to do aerial acrobatics leading to the perfect dunk. It's a dangerous path you're following, but with every dunk you make, the more you solidify your status as a true dunk master. You may not be a professional basketball player, but you are a professional.

About Hoop World

The truth about basketball is that the tricks we hope to see in the air are not as common as we'd like them to be but they're always a spectacle. Even though this game is all about that spectacle over and over again, it's fun to be a part of it. What's more is that it simplifies an act that would otherwise be very difficult to pull off with complex controls, much less real life. In doing so, it becomes more enjoyable to see just how far you can push the player. Even if you drop the ball, it's easy to pick it back up again and get back to flipping out.

How to Play

Hoop World is a 3D basketball arcade game where you're trying to perform the best flipping dunks using only the mouse. To start the dunk, click the Left Mouse Button and the player will jump. While in the air, you can click and hold the Left Mouse Button to perform flips. Letting go of the button will stop the flips, and doing so while the player and ball are facing forward, you'll be in a dunk position. The goal is to dunk the ball in the basket of each level so that you can progress. If you miss the dunk or mess up a flip, you'll need to start again.

While in the lobby, you can spend any coins you've earned in the store. These can be used to unlock different players, different balls, and different aerial maneuvers. Once you start playing, the player will start at their jumping point. From there, you can initiate the dunk whenever you want. While in the air, you can perform flips, and the more you do, the better your score and the more easily you can unlock future levels. Levels will also start to introduce elements like trampolines to bounce on and wormholes to jump through. If you ever land on your head on a trampoline or aren't in a dunk position when near the basket, the player will fail and you'll have to retry.

Tips and Tricks

Trampolines are where you most have to watch your timing and positioning. You can bounce off them while flipping, but any head contact will knock out the player. Use the number of flips tracked at the top to gain a sense of what's possible and when the basket will come into range.

  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile), iOS, and Android
  • Languages: English, French, Japanese, Chinese, German, Spanish, Portuguese, Korean, Indonesian, Italian, Polish, and Russian

title: Survival 456 But It's Impostor
detail:
Squid Game and Among Us were both hits in their fields so someone decided to combine them into Survival 456 But It's Impostor. It takes the visuals from one and combines it with the structure of the other. You are a person in a masked suit who has decided to compete in a very dangerous game in hopes of winning untold riches. It's a battle royale in some ways and in others, it's more of a survival game. You may feel the desire to make alliances in order to last longer but you'll never stop seeing the other players as opponents.

About Survival 456 But It's Impostor

When money is involved, people have been known to do things beyond their limits or considerations but the best we can do is try to stay alive. This is a game where it's all about trying to focus on yourself while the others do the same. There are games where you're competing directly against other players while some games involve teams and others are like endurance challenges. The different games provide variety to change how you interact with the gameplay elements. They're also short enough that having to retry isn't that big of a punishment. If you mess up, just put on your suit and try again.

How to Play

Survival 456 But It's Impostor is a competitive 2D collection of mini games that you can play with just the mouse. Since the game was made for mobile devices, the mouse serves to navigate and tap using the Left Mouse Button. Each game has its own controls which incorporate moving the cursor and clicking the Left Mouse Button in some way. Certain games may have onscreen UI to make things clearer. The goal of each mini game is to make it to the end of the particular trial. If you do, you'll be rewarded with coins and sometimes diamonds. If you fail, you'll receive little but can try again.

You'll have a selection of mini-games and can choose whichever ones are unlocked. Locked mini games require diamonds for them to be opened. On the menu screen, you have the option to spin the wheel on the left side for extra rewards. Certain games will also let you spin the wheel occasionally for a chance at a power-up. After finishing a game, you'll see a figure meter on the right that when it fills up will unlock a new skin in the skin shop. You can choose to spend coins to unlock a random skin if you wish. There's also a home area that you can decorate with decor bought with coins or diamonds.

Tips and Tricks

Depending on the mini game, you'll need to direct your focus. If you're playing in a group, just concentrate on what you're doing. In a team game, sync up with your teammates to make consistent progress. When it's a free-for-all, do your best to not get surrounded. Always think carefully about your next move but don't be overly cautious.

Survival 456 But It's Impostor Mini-Games

There are currently nine mini games that you can play:

  • Red, Green Light - Only move when the big figure isn't looking at you.
  • Tug Of War - Work with your team to pull the other team into the pit.
  • Battle - Eliminate all the other players!
  • Glass Bridge - Hop between glass panes to fight the safe path.
  • Dalgona Candy - Carefully trace the shape of the candy.
  • Marbles - Throw marbles and knock out your opponents.
  • Rope Rescue - Trace a safe path for the rope and the players to follow.
  • Zombie Attack - Fight off waves of the undead!
  • Race To Escape - Run to reach the end of a deadly obstacle course!

title: Red Stickman: Fighting Stick
detail:
What's great about a stickman is that they have the potential to be anything thing like a classic hero in Red Stickman: Fighting Stick. There's a red stickman who has decided to undertake a quest that involves fighting monsters in a dungeon. There are many imprisoned within and many treasures to be found. The red stickman may be a trained warrior but the odds may be stacked against them in these dungeons with all these traps and monsters. That's why you need to help guide their blade true to the target and help them navigate the treacherous areas.

About Red Stickman: Fighting Stick

The classic quest is still a popular game premise with any type of character being welcome to try it out, including stickmen. This game uses that premise and has you controlling a capable and stylish stick figure. The adventure is solid and clear with all the guidance that you need to head from one end of the map to the other while collecting and fighting everything that gets in your way. It can be seen as easy but also enjoyable and satisfying to complete levels and get more goodies to take into the levels with you. The stickman is red with the pride of being a dungeon-crawling hero!

How to Play

Red Stickman: Fighting Stick is a 2D platform game about a red stickman fighting their way through dungeons using the keyboard.

Controls

  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right
  • Up Arrow - Jump (press again to Double Jump)
  • Spacebar - Attack

The goal of each level is to find the key and then get to the exit at the end. The stickman has their health shown in the top left corner and their gold in the top right. Each hit from an enemy or projectile will take a decent chunk away from their health but certain traps like spikes and acid can cause instant death. When stickman dies, they'll respawn at the last checkpoint. If they lose all their lives, indicated by a number near their health, you'll need to start the level from the beginning. Your world progression is shown at the top of the screen at the start of each level.

Before you begin the adventure, you can explore the main menu to give your stickman different skins, weapons, and pets. The first two are cosmetic, but pets can earn you more gold and have additional effects. You can unlock more items by completing achievements, spending gold, and watching ads. When you start the level, you'll spawn on the far left and have to start making your way through.

In addition to platforming, hazards will take the form of traps, enemies, and mechanics. Most enemies will move the ground or through the air damaging on contact, while others will throw projectiles or explode if you get too close. You can either avoid enemies or dispatch them with your sword. There are moving platforms, springs to launch you up, blocks to push, and buttons to press to activate features like opening doors. At the end of each world, you'll get to face off against a boss. The bosses will face you in a contained arena so both it and you can move around.

The main collectible is gold, but you can also find power-ups like magnets and extra lives to aid you. There are also red gems that are carried by enemies and when you collect three, you'll have the chance to open several chests for extra rewards. Lastly, you can collect letters that spell SWORD which will unlock a new sword as a result. Of course, you can also find swords to pick up and equip in the level itself.

Tips and Tricks

You need to know that the stickman has a pretty big hitbox that can work against them when trying to squeeze past traps or weave through enemies. Your sword has a decent range meaning you don't have to get super close to enemies to hit them. Make sure you check the walls as well to find secret passages that can net you greater rewards.

title: Hero 3: Flying Robot
detail:
It takes a lot of qualities to be a hero though being a robot with flying abilities that's programmed for justice is a good start like in Hero 3: Flying Robot. In this entry in the series, the hero is a flying robot that has taken to surveying the city from the alleged safety of the sky. While patrolling, a bunch of colorfully dressed bad guys have perched themselves in various locations where they can get a clear shot of the hero robot as it flies around. That's why you've gotta take control and show them who's protecting the city.

About Hero 3: Flying Robot

The hero series is an interesting one that tries to do something different with each entry and there don't seem to be any limits. This game gives you quite a lot of freedom as a hero since you aren't restricted to the ground and can freely move in the open air. This gives you a lot of options in terms of targeting bad guys and unleashing your robot's might. Of course, you need to be conscious of collateral damage but luckily your weapons seem to be designed not to break anything.

How to Play

Hero 3: Flying Robot is a 3D third-person game about controlling a flying robot that fires all sorts of weapons using the mouse and keyboard.

Controls

  • Cursor - Look/Aim
  • Left Mouse Button - Fire Laser Blasts
  • Right Mouse Button - Fire Laser Beam
  • W/Up Arrow - Move Forward
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Backward
  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right
  • F - Fire Rockets
  • Shift - Speed Up

The goal is to eliminate all the enemies in the city before moving on. Your health will be shown in the bottom left corner while your weapon cooldowns are at the bottom of the screen. The number of enemies in the city is shown in the top corner of the screen and aiming reticles will outline where they are in the city. If you're taken down before you take them down, you'll have to try the level from the beginning.

Unlike other characters, this flying robot is designed to have unlimited ammo in all of its weapons. All you need to worry about is the cooldown for your rockets and laser beam. The laser blaster is infinite and precise. Enemies are easy to spot with their bright colors and come in two varieties small and large. When you're in range of enemy attacks, they'll aim with red laser sights and shoot at you with various weapons.

Tips and Tricks

The robot is quite powerful and has a lot of mobility that you can use to your advantage. As long as you keep moving, enemies will have a very hard time hitting you. You can also be quite accurate with your laser blasts while rockets can be locked onto multiple targets.

title: Battledudes.io
detail:
If you're going to get into IO games, you'd better prepare to encounter a lot of fast-moving pieces and graphics like in BattleDudes IO. The title pretty much says it all: There are dudes and they're locked in a battle. It all comes down to what kind of dude you'd like to be. Are you gonna be a badass action dude or a more strategic dude? There's a fair amount that you can add to your loadout to help you be different dudes. No matter what you choose, you better be ready to run and gun while avoiding shots from every which way.

About BattleDudes IO

Any game that throws the concept of a "battle" as soon as it can preps you for the type of game and speed of gameplay that you can expect. This game starts up fast and within literal seconds, you can be on a huge battlefield fighting all sorts of dudes. It can be a bit of a shock like being thrown into the deep end of a pool without even knowing what water is. Still, sometimes the best way to learn is as you go and the sooner you enter the battle, the sooner you'll realize how much you'll need to adapt and how.

How to Play

BattleDudes IO is a 2D top-down multiplayer competitive game that you can play using the mouse and keyboard.

Controls

  • Cursor - Look/Aim
  • Left Mouse Button - Fire/Use
  • Right Mouse Button - Emotes
  • W/Up Arrow - Move Up
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Down
  • A/Left Arrow - Turn Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Turn Right
  • R - Reload
  • Num. 1-5 - Cycle Weapons/Items
  • Q - Quick Cycle
  • E - Interact
  • M - Open Map

The goal of the game will change depending on the mode, but the general idea involves eliminating enemy players while staying alive. In the main lobby, you can change your loadout to determine what gear you have, what perks you use, and how your dude looks. By playing the game, completing challenges, and visiting the shop, you can unlock more features for your dude. Note that much of the content will be locked unless you make an account.

Due to the top-down perspective, you get a wide view of the map so you see through walls and around objects to spot enemies. However, there is a fog of war element in play that mainly applies to closed rooms with no windows. They'll only be revealed by entering the room. Your stats will be shown in the bottom left part of the screen. If your health drops to zero, you'll be eliminated and may have to wait a few seconds to respawn. Points of interest will be indicated on your screen and enemies will not have icons over their positions, simply opposing colored highlights.

Some maps give you access to vehicles that use similar movement controls. If you get to drive a tank, you'll be able to use its cannon on the field.

Tips and Tricks

This is a very fast game where you need to keep moving and shooting back whenever enemies take shots at you. There's no friendly fire and enemy bullets will be highlighted in the opposing color. Always track your ammo usage so that you don't have to reload in a tight spot and use the overworld objects for additional protection.

BattleDudes IO Modes

This IO game offers a lot of different modes to try:

  • Team Deathmatch - You and your teammates try to eliminate as many enemy players as possible.
  • Capture The Flag - Steal the opposing team's flag and bring it back to base.
  • Football CTF - Fight over the one flag object and bring it back to your base.
  • Upload - Get the computer, plug it into your base, and defend it until it finishes uploading.
  • Control Points - Capture and hold multiple points as possible for as long as possible.
  • Payload - Push and defend a cart along the track to your base.

Game Details

  • Developer: Sarunas
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile), iOS, and Android
  • Languages: English

Is BattleDudes IO full of bots?

It's a very common occurrence for IO games to fill their games with bots, but this is one that has a sizable online community of real players.
