title: Squid Shooter
detail:
When Squid Game came out on Netflix, it's safe to say that many were glued to their screens to watch it and others were prepared to make games about it like Squid Shooter. The world of Squid Game is a brutal one and this game captures that to a degree but with much less brutality and more ragdoll physics going on. It follows the premise of the show to a very basic degree with the most notable connection being the assets. Still, it lets you revisit a lot of the elements of the series as you unleash firepower on all of them.

About Squid Shooter

It seems like forever since Squid Game came out and the creator has been taking his time with continuing it. To hold us over, we've had to deal with many games related to the show, some being realistic and others more comical. This game leans towards the latter while having a battle royale kind of touch to it. It's an endurance challenge that tests your perseverance and your curiosity to see just how long you can go. There may be an end to this particular Squid Game if you're willing to see it through, but it could take you quite some time.

How to Play

Squid Shooter is a 3D first-person shooter set in the Squid Game universe that is controlled with a mouse and keyboard.

Controls

  • Mouse Cursor - Look/Aim
  • Right Mouse Button - Precise Aim
  • Left Mouse Button - Fire
  • W/Up Arrow - Move Forward
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Back
  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right
  • Num. Keys - Cycle Through Weapons
  • R - Reload
  • F/Q - Melee Attacks
  • G - Throw Grenade
  • T - Look At Weapon
  • E - Discard Weapon

The game is presented in levels and the goal of each one is to eliminate all of the opponents in the arena. The number of opponents you need to defeat is tracked in the top left corner of the screen. Your health and ammo is shown in the bottom left corner of the screen. If your health bar is fully depleted, you'll have to restart the level.

Each level begins with you spawning in a random location as enemies begin to make their way toward your location. Enemies will vary in shape and size but will attack using a variety of melee weapons. Other enemies will spawn in vantage points on various structures where they will throw projectiles and grenades at you. You're restricted to the ground but are free to move around and use the structures as cover.

Between levels, you can choose different weapons and power-ups to take into battle. The ones you buy will occupy the numbered slot of that weapon type. As indicated by the note, everything you buy will only last two levels.

Tips and Tricks

There's absolutely no rush to eliminate enemies as quickly as possible as everything is in your favor. Enemies move very slowly and you have so much health to absorb damage. The biggest threats are grenades so keep an eye out for their highlighted icons.

Game Details

  • Developer: UncreativeAri
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile) and Android
  • Languages: English and Russian

title: Spinner.io
detail:
Depending on where you grew up, you may have seen kids battling it out with spinning tops and trying to knock each other out and that continues in Spinner IO. Anime is not the only pop-culture media that has turned spinning tops into a fierce competition. You aren't just the top owner, you are the top itself. It has your mind and your moves and your will to win and keep spinning. All other tops are standing in the way of a smooth life of spinning and they need to be dealt with. Spin for power and use that power to spin your opponents out of the arena.

About Spinner IO

Spinning tops may look pretty simple and easy to understand, but there is a lot happening beneath the surface. This game has a distinctive surface and you can figure out what's underneath fairly quickly. It's just about spinning tops and finding ways to approach your opponents so that you can knock them out. You may spend time in the match chasing after other tops or being bounced around like a pinball, but that's just what you can expect. How you recover from the loss of control is the test of skill that will keep you in the game and make you want to keep spinning and fighting.

How to Play

Spinner IO is a 3D isometric battle game about spinning tops trying to knock each other by using only the mouse. To take control of your top, click and hold the Left Mouse Button anywhere on the screen. To move the top, just drag the cursor around and your top will follow its position. The goal is to be the last top standing by knocking out all the other tops out of the arena. If you're knocked out, you'll need to wait until the next match.

The spinners operate on bumper mechanics, meaning that you need to spin into other tops to bump them around. It's based on momentum so the tops that gain more ground are able to hit much harder. Small bumps can interrupt momentum by knocking you off your current path. The arenas can be in different shapes but don't have any borders meaning that tops will fall off if knocked out. The more matches you win, the higher your rank and the more skins you unlock.

Tips and Tricks

This is a battle where you want to stay out of the center as much as you can. The more tops you hit back to back, the harder it will be to gain control and build up momentum. Tops are less likely to stay near the edges, so you should take advantage of this space to build speed and then sweep back into the fray with a massive hit.

Game Details

  • Developer: Yad
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

Is Spinner IO played with real people?

Though it is an IO game and could potentially be hosted effectively on a server, its current form only has you playing against computer tops.

title: Idle Mining Empire
detail:
They used to say that if you wanted to seek your fortune then you should get a job at a mine and work hard until you strike gold, or you can start an Idle Mining Empire. It's one of the most dangerous jobs in the world, but someone has to do it and for many, it's their main way to make a living. You can see how many steps go into mining from the hitting of rock to the collecting and shipping of its various recipients. With the right planning and work ethic, you can set up a smooth-running mining operation that is hopefully safe as well.

About Idle Mining Empire

Mining is a very serious job and has been the topic of many types of games where it's all about trying to find the materials you need to progress. In this game, you're not mining directly or even playing as a miner, but you're overseeing all of the operations. Nothing happens unless you say so which is why you have to stay on the ball to keep your workers motivated and safe. By doing this, you can start to see your efforts yield a profit which will lead to bigger and better things taking you beyond mining. Can you dig it?

How to Play

Idle Mining Empire is a 2D idle game about setting up and running a mining business using only the mouse. The game UI is all controlled by moving the cursor over to the different elements and then clicking with the Left Mouse Button. To direct your workers, you need to click on them when they're idling and they'll perform their duties before returning back to the idling state. The goal is to grow and expand a mining empire as you dig deeper and for greater profit.

The operations are broken into three different areas: Mining, collecting, and transporting. Click your miner to have them mine some coal and transport it to the nearby cart. Click the elevator operator to descend and collect coal from carts and then process it for shipping. Click the transport worker on the surface to collect the processed goal and ship it out to gain profit. The profit can be put toward upgrading each of the areas to be more efficient and effective. You can also use it to unlock new mine shafts and higher managers to automate your workers.

If a worker is not active, they will have some Zs floating by their head. Managers work automatically and can sometimes be boosted to speed up their automation effects.

Tips and Tricks

This is an idle game that requires a fair amount of input on your part. Until you upgrade enough to unlock more managers, you need to be hands-on with your clicking and enter into a rhythm moving between the different areas. Mines should always take priority for upgrades followed by the collection areas.

  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English, French, Arabic, Indonesian, Turkish, Portuguese, Spanish, Hebrew, Chinese, Japanese, German, Italian, and Russian

title: Bank Robbery
detail:
The idea of carrying out the perfect heist is a part of many action fantasies but rarely do they ever go well resulting in battles like the ones in Bank Robbery. You play as one of several masked robbers who are in the process of robbing a bank when police forces decide to storm the place. It's a 3D first-person shooter with polygonal graphics and very blocky enemies and teammates to encounter. Unfortunately, one of your teammates is busy counting and collecting the money so it's mainly up to you and any other free NPC allies to help out by fighting back continuing police assault.

About Bank Robbery

You would think that stealing whether from a bank or a house would require a bit more finesse. Well, the game has already taken care of one part by getting you into the bank, now you just have to survive. You've got a lot of space and structures to work with in this workplace battlefield as you try to get the drop on police with whatever weapons you're able to afford. It's fast and satisfying to land shots, but you can't be too careless otherwise the shots and more powerful units will quickly descend down on your limited health.

How to Play

Bank Robbery is a fast-paced FPS controlled between the mouse and keyboard. It can have quick and short movements based on the inputs.

Controls

  • Mouse Cursor - Look Aim
  • Left Mouse Button - Fire/Attack
  • Right Mouse Button - Precise Aim
  • W - Move Forward
  • S - Move Backward
  • A - Move Left
  • D - Move Right
  • R - Reload
  • C - Crouch
  • Q/E or Mousewheel - Cycle through weapons

The game is fairly simple in that it's an endurance challenge. When you're active, you're free to move around the bank while police forces will spawn in certain areas (indicated by smoke). Enemies and allies are tracked with the compass line at the top of the screen marked with red and green respectively. When you eliminate all the enemies, you'll earn some money and health will be restored. The number of waves you need to complete will be shown in the top left corner of the screen. When all waves have been completed, you'll return to the money screen where you can buy new weapons and hire help. The goal is to earn enough money to buy a helicopter and escape.

Tips and Tricks

The enemies move in very randomized patterns and will often flee or charge you as you get closer. For each enemy type, a close-up headshot will always do massive damage but don't risk running out in the open to land it. If things are too hard, you can grind the same few waves in whatever level you're on in order to earn some extra money.

  • Languages: English

While the setup of the game would leave room for local or online multiplayer between cops and robbers, it's currently a single-player game. It's just you as one of the robbers fighting against waves of computer-controlled police.

While bank robberies still do occur around the world, this game is a fictional scenario of how a bank robbery could play out.

title: Tentrix
detail:
You never know what games are going to be timeless until enough time passes and Tetris has achieved that status while spawning successors like TenTrix. It was the simplicity of building blocks together that made it appealing while reaching both serious and casual players. The gameplay has been recreated numerous times but typically maintains the trademark colorful blocks in their distinct arrangements. This game gives you a selection of blocks to put together as you see essentially giving you more options while applying new restrictions. Even so, the spirit of Tetris is alive and well both on PC and on mobile.

About TenTrix

For those familiar with Tetris, this game could be seen as a toned-down version. It has all the puzzle and strategy mechanics of its predecessor while putting less pressure on you. The combination of falling pieces with the catchy music can make Tetris tense, but here the tension is mainly caused by your own moves and strategy. You never know what arrangements you're going to get but you always have a selection so you can build wherever you want on the grid. The decisions you make essentially determine the gameplay since the more creative your structuring, the more you can play the game.

How to Play

TenTrix gives you control of arrangements of blocks that you can lay on the free spaces of a 10x10 grid. Your available pieces appear at the bottom of the screen, and you'll always receive a selection of three. To place a piece, click and drag the piece you want, then let go of the part of the grid you want to place it. After all three have been placed, you'll get three new pieces. The pieces can take multiple shapes.

Possible Shapes

  • L Shape
  • Line Shape
  • Square Shape
  • Small L Shape

You can't rotate any of the shapes as their rotations will be determined beforehand. The goal is to place pieces creatively to make full horizontal or vertical lines across the grid which will then be removed and converted to points. The game ends when there are no possible moves left to make and you're always aiming for a higher score.

Tips and Tricks

Since you can't rotate the pieces, think very carefully as to how their placement will affect the grid. Fill up the corners if you can so you can leave as much of the center as open as possible. Line pieces should be saved for the sides of the grid.

Game Details

  • Developer: GamePix
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

Gameplay Footage

FAQs

Is this game similar to TanTrix?

Despite the similar names, TenTrix and Tantrix are two very different games. The latter involves arranging hexagonal pieces on a board to match up colored lines and was created by Mike McManaway of New Zealand.

title: Moto X3m: Spooky Land
detail:
It's not Halloween right now but there are still scary places to visit and ride bikes through. That's why you have the option provided in Moto X3M Spooky Land for haunted motorcycle action if that's what you like. Riding a motorcycle is a pretty dangerous activity and there's a whole sport around trying to make it as dangerous and radical as possible. You're playing a rider who laughs in the face of death or simply has an extremely high pain tolerance. And there is a lot of pain to be had considering this is a land themed around scary and dangerous stuff which means your rider will need to ride a bit more safely this time around.

About Moto X3M Spooky Land

By this point, this particular rider is used to riding a motorcycle in seemingly fantastical environments and is not afraid to wipe out. This game sets him in a place that is thematically made to be dangerous and life-threatening but you can't let that stop you. Speed will help carry you through a lot of the close calls, but you also need control so your ride doesn't end early. Just riding from one end of the level to the other is risky enough but if you want to tempt fate, you can try pulling off a few flips should you find a nice spot of clear non-haunted air.

How to Play

Moto X3M Spooky Land is a 2D motorcycle game about riding through a spooky-themed world using the keyboard.

Controls

  • W/Up Arrow - Accelerate
  • S/Down Arrow - Brake/Reverse
  • A/Left Arrow - Lean Back
  • D/Right Arrow - Lean Forward
  • Spacebar – Reset

The goal of each level is to get to the end as quickly as possible. The end is marked with a checkered pattern section and as long as the rider's body or bike touches it, it will count as complete. The faster you finish, the more stars you earn and these can be used to unlock spooky riders and new bikes.

When the level starts, you're free to ride. The courses are laid out ahead of you and you simply need to follow the path to reach the end. Though the rider is sturdy, he'll be tossed from the bike if his head or body comes into contact with anything solid. If he comes into contact with a hazard like spikes or slips from collapsing platforms, the bike is toast. A majority of the levels will have you riding across tracks and through sections made of bones. As long as you maintain speed and stay the course, you'll make it through.

You can perform flips and spins while airborne by leaning hard to the left or right, but be sure to land on the wheels or prepare to reset.

Tips and Tricks

As wild as the tracks may seem, you need to trust your bike and keep it under control. As long as you're able to keep the wheels touching the ground, you'll be in a solid position. Just be cautious when going over sharp bumps or through narrow sections.

  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

title: Merge Mine - Idle Clicker
detail:
Mining is one of the hardest jobs that you can do, which is why many of us will only get to experience it in things like Merge Mine - Idle Clicker. Look at you; you've managed to find an untapped diamond vein. Who knows how many diamonds are in there? It could set you up for life, but first, you've got to get them out of there. This is where all that hard work comes into play, and maybe you can use some of your newly acquired shiny stones to pay for things so that you can get even more shiny stones until you're all set.

About Merge Mine - Idle Clicker

The mining game catalog may be longer than so many other catalogs, and there's a reason for that… people like mining for precious minerals. This game will have you mining for the prized stone known as the diamond. Whether in real life or in games, when you get your hands on diamonds, things are usually looking up. What makes things hard is that diamonds aren't the easiest things to mine, so you'll need some determination and patience. You'll also need to spend money to make diamonds, and then things will go more smoothly than just working alone. What's yours is mine.

How to Play

Merge Mine - Idle Clicker is a 3D idle clicker game about mining diamonds so that you can mine more diamonds with the mouse. To mine, move the cursor over to the diamond vein and then click the Left Mouse Button. This is also how you interact with the game UI around the diamond vein. The goal is to keep mining diamonds until you've mined enough diamonds to satisfy yourself. You can keep mining yourself or leave it to someone else.

When you begin, there will be the vein and grid below it. Above the grid are icons you can use for upgrades, and at the bottom is a place to buy tools. When you buy a tool, it will take up an empty slot in the grid. You can merge it with another tool of the same type to make a newer and stronger tool. From there, you can assign it to the middle slot at the top to give it to your hired worker. The more you spend on tools and upgrades, the more diamonds you'll mine over time, even when you decide to take a break.

Tips and Tricks

Since this is an idle game, there's value in just leaving it running so that diamonds can accumulate in your absence. You'll need to make sure that the game stays active in the browser; otherwise, it'll just pause until you return. Tools will get more expensive as you buy more, so do a dedicated round of clicking to get a surge of diamonds.

Game Details

  • Developer: Mihai
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile) and Android
  • Languages: English

title: Trap Craft
detail:
When you play Minecraft for the first time, you'll meet zombies fairly quickly and some folks decided to make that the whole danger in Trap Craft. A group of colorfully dressed crafters are all hanging out when a mysterious figure appears on the TV and offers them a deal: Defend a mystical portal from a zombie attack and you'll get whatever you wish. All the crafters jump at this opportunity to make their dreams come true and start planning out their defenses while positioning themselves on the frontlines. These zombies may come in waves and that's why you've got to turn the tides.

About Trap Craft

The tower-defense genre has been around for a long time back to the early days of the internet and they don't have to be overly complex. This game sticks to tradition but also for the 3D third-person perspective. It creates a solid scenario with layouts that seem easy to work with, but you quickly realize just how little resources you have. You have to start being creative with your money and arsenal early on otherwise most of the zombie-repelling duties will fall on you. At least you'll have some good weapons and magic skills to give you a fighting chance.

How to Play

Trap Craft is a 3D tower-defense game set in a Minecraft universe where you need to defend a portal from zombies using the mouse and keyboard.

Controls

  • W/Up Arrow - Move Forward
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Back
  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right

The trap and attacking UI will be visible on-screen with big items depicting the associated items. To place a trap, click on it with the Left Mouse Button and then drag it to the open spot on the floor or wall where you want to place it. To attack, click on a weapon to equip it, then click the attack or magic icons on the right to use it. Your portal condition, health, and mana will be shown on the left side. Mana regenerates over time, but if the portal condition or your health drops to zero, you'll need to restart the level.

After you choose your character, you'll start the level. The portal will be placed behind you and the doors where the zombies will emerge will be on the other side. Before the wave begins, you can place as many traps in the area as you have money. Once you're satisfied, start the wave and aim to eliminate all the zombies. Traps can damage zombies or affect their movement. When they get close to you, they will target you and start to attack. You'll sometimes be given defenders that will automatically attack zombies once they get in range. Clear all of the waves to beat the level, move on, and earn Mutagen.

Tips and Tricks

The trick with tower-defense games is to create concentrated points. It's better to have spots where multiple traps coincide than to have individual traps spread far from each other. The more hits zombies take at once, the easier you can pick them off with attacks and magic.

Game Details

  • Languages: English

title: Teen Titans
detail:
Cartoon Network is still going strong with many new shows and old ones still hanging around that lead to games like Teen Titans. This show was a take on the DC heroes of the same group but made into a wackier version of itself. The Titans are a teenage group of superheroes who fight crime and live together causing trouble for each other. Sometimes they sit around and play games like this one you're about to play in their stead. Choose the Titan that you want to represent and defeat the others in a virtual jousting contest.

About Teen Titans

Even if you've never watched the show, you've likely heard of the Teen Titans as their reach stretches pretty far. This game is just another element that their hands have touched and they want to invite you to play with them. You can play against the Titans themselves or play this game with a friend to see who can better master the Titans' game system. Unlike other fighters, the controls have been simplified so that you don't have to remember tons of complex combos. All you need are a few buttons to move and attack which will let you win or feel defeated in no time.

How to Play

Teen Titans is a 2D versus game with jumping and jousting between the Titans' avatars that you can play with just the keyboard.

Player One Controls

  • F - Jump Left
  • G - Jump Right
  • A - Attack
  • S - Use Special

Player Two Controls

  • Left Arrow - Jump Left
  • Right Arrow - Jump Right
  • K - Attack
  • L - Use Special

The goal is to defeat your opponent by reducing their life counter. Standard attacks will do one notch of damage while special attacks can do three or more depending on whether they hit multiple times. A character's special attack will fill up as indicated by the Go in their respective corners. The match ends when either one character is knocked out or the timer ends upon which the character with the most health is declared the winner.

Each character has three standard attacks available to them. When standing still, the character will attack with a specific movement. While jumping forward the character will use an offensive attack. While jumping backward, the character will use a defensive attack. Special attacks will always be the same no matter what position they're executed. When attacks are launched at each other, the one that makes contact first will succeed.

Before starting the match, you'll have the option to choose your fighter. More fighters will be unlocked as you play through the game and win with each of them.

Tips and Tricks

Since this is a fighting game with limited movement, each character's abilities will stand out more clearly. Practice with them to determine which characters are offensive and which are defensive. Learn their special moves so that you know the best time to use them and always be on guard when the opponent's special meter is full.

Game Details

  • Developer: Arf Game Studio
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

This is a competitive fighting game with both a single-player and multiplayer mode, but you'll only be able to play locally with someone else.

title: Pixel Gun Apocalypse 2
detail:
The trick to making a well-running online game may be to set in a blocky universe similar to that of Minecraft which is what Pixel Gun Apocalypse 2. This is a sequel where the soldiers are all ready to jump right into the battle with all the cubes and squares they can pull together for armor and weapons. You'll also see some esthetics from Minecraft as you run through the battlefield but don't let that charm distract you. The players move quickly and can be very accurate which means that you need to stay on your guard. Do that and you may stand a chance to reach some sort of win.

About Pixel Gun Apocalypse 2

You may not be familiar with the pixel gun apocalypse that happened in the gaming world but it seems to have continued. This game is proof that the apocalypse was so big that it could not be contained to only one game. It needed more servers to support more players as they play a more mature version of blocks but on their computers. The movement can be pretty sharp and fast despite the blockiness, but this just means you need to be more aware of your surroundings. Keep moving to try and get the drop on enemies before they do the same to you.

How to Play

Pixel Gun Apocalypse 2 is a 3D first-person online shooter with a blocky look that you can play with the mouse and keyboard.

Controls

  • Cursor - Look/Aim
  • Left Mouse Button - Fire
  • Right Mouse Button - Precise Aim
  • W/Up Arrow - Move Forward
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Backward
  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right
  • Spacebar - Jump
  • Shift - Sprint
  • C - Crouch
  • R – Reload

The goal is to take out as many enemy players as you can. You'll have four main weapons to switch between and will respawn upon death after a few seconds until the round ends. You can play solo Deathmatch against everyone else or Team Deathmatch with allies against an enemy team.

In terms of FPS gameplay, this is quite traditional. You can move quickly and deliberately with the mouse allowing for quick turns and aiming. The battlefield is full of structures with ways to climb on top and others to go down below. Each kill nets you a point and you'll want to have the highest score by the time the round ends. Allies and enemies are visually distinguishable, but allies will have green names above their heads.

Tips and Tricks

Like other competitive FPS games, you need to be able to move and shoot accurately. Sprinting, jumping, and spinning are all movements that you're going to need to master while at the same time sharpening your aiming skills.

title: Slope Racing 3d
detail:
When it comes to racing, if you're on a slope then it comes down to who gravity favors most and that's who's in charge in Slope Racing 3D. You have entered what may or may not be an area of the Tron universe where you aren't encountering humanoid programs and the only thing that seems to draw attention is a 3D ball. The ball wants to reach the bottom of the slope even if there is no bottom and you have to help it achieve its dream. While gravity may be doing most of the work, you're the one with most of the control.

About Slope Racing 3D

A rolling ball is a basic concept to base a game on but many titles have done it with quite a significant amount of success. This game seeks to join their ranks since it's got the ball, it's got the rolling, and it's got the ball rolling. You're along for the ride as you follow this ball down an endless slope and do your best to keep it out of danger. The challenge ramps up as you go down the numerous randomized ramps. It can get some excitement flowing as paths narrow and more obstacles show up, but you need to remember to keep your eye on the ball.

How to Play

Slope Racing 3D is a 3D endless runner about a ball rolling down a slope with the help of the mouse and keyboard. You can steer the ball left and right by using the A/Left Arrow and D/Right Arrow keys respectively. You also have access to power-ups that will show up on the right side of the screen that you can select and use with the cursor and Left Mouse Button. The goal is to roll the ball as long and as far down as possible, collecting as many gems as you can along the way.

The ball will automatically roll down the slope and you just need to steer it. It will maintain a constant pace but can be boosted by the yellow boost pads that will appear on the track. The only collectibles are gems which you can grab by rolling the ball into them. The track will change as you roll such as becoming narrower, tilting back and forth, and having gaps that the ball can fall through. Aside from falling through holes or off the sides, there are red blocks that will destroy the ball on contact which will appear scattered across the track.

There are three available power-ups: Shield, Magnet, and Multiplier. The Shield will protect the ball from red blocks. The Magnet will let the ball collect gems from a distance. The Multiplier will improve your distance score. Power-ups can be bought from the shop on the main menu using gems, along with different skins for the ball.

Controls

There are only two buttons that you'll need to play the game from your keyboard:

  • Left Arrow/A/Q - Steer ball left
  • Right Arrow/D/E - Steer ball right

By doing this, you need to keep the ball on the borderless track while avoiding obstacles. Anything dangerous that appears in your way will be a noticeable red color. These objects can take the form of stationary or moving blocks as well as tunnels with red walls. If you hit any of these or fall off the sides, the run ends.

Tips and Tricks

The good thing is that you'll be able to see far down the slope so that you can know what to expect. Whenever there are boosters, focus on hitting them as they tend to indicate a large jump coming up. Don't try to get all the gems and focus on staying in the middle of the track.

Game Details

  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

Gameplay Footage

FAQs

Is there an ending to Slope Racing 3D?

As an endless-runner, this game is designed to go on forever but you can consider it complete once you obtain all of the different skins.

title: Paper.io 2
detail:
There are times when you can head out to paint the town red and that can be taken quite literally when playing a game like Paper IO 2. The sequel to the popular online game returns you to a town that is a large blank canvas that is screaming out for a splash of color. You can choose to be the red cube that paints it red or you can be some other cube painting it a different color or perhaps a wild pattern. Unfortunately, the town isn't big enough for all of us and some cubes need to be painted out to go elsewhere.

About Paper IO 2

The Paper series has come a long way from being a small and simple but still active online computer game. This sequel has taken the game to new heights with a bigger size, flashier graphics, and greater player support. The core gameplay is still there with all the solid fun that can be had by painting large portions of a blank space with all sorts of colors. Together the cubes could create forms of art by cooperatively painting, but there would be little competition in doing so. Become the envy of all the other cubes by painting up a storm and bringing the canvas to life your way.

How to Play

Paper IO 2 is a 3D isometric competitive game about using a cube to paint with either the mouse or keyboard. The WASD/Arrow Keys can be used to steer the cube in the designated direction since the cube will move at a constant pace on its own. Unlike similar games, there is no "Dash" ability. By using the mouse cursor, you can lead the cube around as it will follow the position of the cursor. The goal of the game is to paint the majority of the canvas and stay at the top rank.

Before beginning, you can choose a name for your cube and a style. It can have a single color or you can give a different form which will cause it to paint a related pattern. When the game starts, your cube will spawn in an empty space with a portion already painted. It will start moving and in order to paint, you need to lead the cube to create a trail and then close it by returning to the solid painted portion. You can safely paint over different-colored areas but if another cube comes into contact with your trail or if you run over it yourself, your cube will be destroyed and you'll need to start again. However, you can also eliminate other cubes by running over their trails.

Tips and Tricks

A lot of your strategy can be based on where you spawn on the canvas. If you spawn in the middle of other painted areas, you'll need to start small and gradually paint outwards in a spreading pattern. If you spawn away from the center, take advantage of all the untouched canvas before going after other cubes.

title: Penalty Kick Wiz
detail:
Football is one of the most popular sports for a reason, but the reason keeps changing depending on who you ask though the excitement of moments like Penalty Kick Wiz certainly contributes. Yes, a football match can be so long, intense, and neck-and-neck that it all comes down to the player-versus-player battle of the penalty kick. This is a third-person game about trying to score goals as the attacker and block them as the defender. It's all about trying to get into the heads of your opponents and being able to react as quickly as you can to make sure that your team stays in the lead.

About Penalty Kick Wiz

Though the world of football is a huge one with teams and individual players getting a lot of attention, penalty kicks bring it down to the individual. It creates the closest thing that the game has to a one-on-one fight where it's just an attacker and a defender. No matter which side you're on, you can feel the tension of the situation. This is a game-defining event where even the slightest mistake can cost you the whole game. It captures the idea of a physical test as much as it is a mental one.

How to Play

Penalty Kick Wiz is contained to a game screen that only requires you to use the mouse to make and block shots. The main gameplay UI element appears when you're making a shot. A target will move back and forth along the bottom of the net. By clicking the left mouse button, you can stop the target and take the shot toward where it stopped. When you are blocking, the target doesn't appear until after the attacker decides to take the shot. Once it does appear, you can click the target to dive toward it in an attempt to block the shot.

Each team has five attempts to score points, as shown in the top left corner of the screen. A winner is determined once one side makes more goals than is possible for the other side to match. In the case of a tie, additional shots will be taken. Your objective is to beat as many teams in sequence in order to win cups.

Tips and Tricks

There's not much to this game, but the key factors are timing and versatility. Try to avoid making the same shot twice to keep the goalie on his toes. When blocking, be sure not to dive too early and try to time it with the attacker just before he takes the shot.

Game Details

  • Developer: dparrotint
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile) and Android
  • Languages: English

Gameplay Footage

Can you pause during a penalty kick?

Although this game lets you pause and takes as much time as you want, in professional play it is actually illegal to stop moving once the player starts moving toward the ball.

title: Kogama: Adopt Children And Form Your Family
detail:
Society often expects people to settle down and have children at some point but there are already so many children in need of homes which is what Kogama: Adopt Children and Form Your Family is trying to show. This is another entry in the Kogama series where your friendly blocky humanoid is aiming to create a family. Whether you're looking to do it on your own or with a partner, there are plenty of children who would be happy to go to a stable and loving home. Just make sure that when you adopt them, you have everything that you need to take care of them.

About Kogama: Adopt Children and Form Your Family

The Kogama series tends to revolve around community-created content with a sandbox or sim-like feel to it. This game is pretty clear that it wants to simulate aspects of adopting and building a family. Many other players are roaming around with the same objective as well as a fairly large city to explore alone or with your family. You don't have tasks or missions to complete, it's all about making a life in this Kogama world. Ideally, you'll end up with a peaceful life with a caring family that you helped bring together through love and fun.

How to Play

Kogama: Adopt Children and Form Your Family is a 3D sim-like game about making a family using the mouse and keyboard.

Controls

  • Cursor - Look/Aim
  • Left Mouse Button - Fire/Attack
  • W/Up Arrow - Move Forward
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Backward
  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right
  • Spacebar - Jump
  • E - Collect/Use

The goal is to live a life and try to make a family by adopting children and possibly finding a partner. Your health and funds are shown in the top left corner of the screen. If you take too much damage from reckless activity, you'll need to start over.

Before you begin, you'll have the option to use coins and such to customize your avatar with various cosmetics. When you decide to play, you can choose any of the unlocked classes which will have different appearances and the potential for skills. After you've selected your character, you'll spawn in a specific location in the world. You can go in and hope to find a baby or child to adopt into your family. Whether you do so or don't, there will be a variety of hover vehicles available for driving nearby. There will also be purple coins floating around to collect and these will be needed to make purchases in the world such as buying a house. You're free to explore the city and live life as you see fit.

Your spawn point and role are determined by which team you select. You can choose to be an adopter or an adoptee, but both have the option to explore the city as they'd like.

Tips and Tricks

This is a relaxed experience where you're not given much direction, so you have to come up with your own. You can try to go the traditional route of earning money to build a nice home or throw caution to the wind for an adventurous life. You choose who to take along for the ride.

Game Details

  • Developer: Multiverse ApS
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: Depending on location

Is Kogama: Adopt Children and Form Your Family safe for kids?

This is an online game with chat that would require certain information to register but doesn't need super in-depth details to play this way. Register responsibly and at your discretion, but playing unregistered is very low risk.

How do I add friends on Kogama: Adopt Children and Form Your Family?

You'll need to be registered to be able to add specific contacts which will become available once your account becomes active. Simply search for the players' names in the social tabs to find their accounts.

title: Noob Vs 1000 Zombies!
detail:
Some may wonder what would happen if you placed a novice in a ring with a zombie. Well, some have also attempted to provide an answer with Noob Vs 1000 Zombies! We return once more to the sister universe of Minecraft which is more pixels than a model in nature. A young man is seen frolicking with pigs in the mud when he hears a sheep crying for help. He spots the sheep to see it surrounded by fire, one that has been set by zombies. Enraged, the noob ventures forth to take down all the zombies responsible and bring the sheep home safely.

About Noob Vs 1000 Zombies!

Noob is still a term used in the gaming community to describe someone new to a particular game, but it can also be applied to life. This game makes the noob seem far more capable than expected, even though this one was rolling in the mud with pigs. The noob has the heart and the drive to venture forth but needs your skill to succeed. You need to make use of the noob's skills in this war on zombies. You have access to a pretty effective weapon and the environments can give you a lot to work with, as is usual in Minecraft.

How to Play

Noob Vs 1000 Zombies! Is a 2D puzzle-zombie game about a Minecraft noob fighting zombies with a bow, arrow, and mouse. To aim, hold the Left Mouse Button and move the cursor around. To fire, simply let go of the button and the arrow will fly in a straight line toward the target. The goal is to eliminate all the zombies in the level as efficiently as possible. The fewer arrows you use, the more stars and rewards you get, but if you run out, you'll need to restart.

Before the game begins, you can choose a skin for the noob or unlock a mystery prize using the coins gained from completing levels. When you do decide to play, the noob will be dropped into a set location in the level with one to several zombies. Neither the noob nor the zombies will move, but the noob can fire arrows that have certain properties. They'll get stuck in wooden surfaces but can bounce off rock and metal. They can break boxes, detonate TNT, and even flip switches. Hitting a zombie anywhere with an arrow will kill it instantly and its body can interact with the environment as well. Once all the zombies are dead, again, you can move on to the next level.

There's also the option to play against another player where you both are locked into a randomly arranged arena. A timer will count down and give you time to set up your shot until you can release. The first to hit their opponent wins. Missions will be unlocked over time to challenge your archery skills.

Tips and Tricks

Like other projectile-based puzzle games, this is all about angles and trajectory. You don't need to be perfect in hitting the zombie which allows some room for error, but try to aim for the bulk of their bodies. Make sure you scan the level to see if there are things that can be affected by rogue arrows or falling bodies.

Game Details

  • Developer: Noob vs Pro Team
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile) iOS, and Android
  • Languages: English

Gameplay Footage

There's evidence to suggest that games bearing "Noob Vs" originated from a team of players who would make content based on a noob going against a pro player.

Is Noob Vs 1000 Zombies! Part of a series?

With such a recognizable name, the Noob Vs label covers many games some of which have collections like Noob Vs Zombie, Noob Vs Pro, and solo games like Noob Vs Cops.

title: Combat
detail:
Combat can take on many forms and can occur at any time and any place with online being a prime location thanks to titles like Combat. This is a classic example of an online shooting game where all you're trying to do is be the best. You have limited resources, but a team of people to fight alongside to try and boost your score. You'll need to move quickly and shoot even faster to stay in the game. The bullets will start flying from various locations which will force you to decide on what tactics work best for you and your internet connection.

About Combat

With such a simple title, you could argue that there's not much depth to the game and you can figure everything out with little effort. That's what this game is on the surface, but below the surface is where all the skill lies. You need to remember the times you would play or watch people play in internet cafes or LAN gatherings so you can tap into older game thinking. A lot of that still applies to modern games, only things move much faster so you'll need to move and react just as fast. You may struggle at the start, but there's not usually a long wait to try again.

How to Play

Combat is a 3D first-person shooting game about fighting against other soldiers across different maps using the mouse and keyboard.

Controls

  • Cursor - Look/Aim
  • Left Mouse Button - Attack/Fire
  • Right Mouse Button - Precise Aim
  • W/Up Arrow - Move Forward
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Backward
  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right
  • Mousewheel/Num. Keys - Cycle Weapons
  • R - Reload
  • Spacebar - Jump
  • C - Crouch
  • B - Open Shop
  • F - Collect

The goal is to stay alive as long as possible, minimize your deaths, and take out as many opponents as possible. Your stats will be shown in the lower-left corner of the screen, including your available funds and weapons. When your health hits zero, you'll need to respawn or re-enter the game depending on the mode.

From the main menu, you'll have the option to chat with other players and join specific games. You'll also have the option to examine and customize maps. When you decide to play, you can choose what team you're on for related game modes. You'll then spawn into a specific location on the map and this will be your designated spawn point. As soon as you spawn in, you can start running around looking for the action.

You'll start with only a knife and some cash which can spent to equip certain weapons. You can earn more cash by defeating opponents. There are also places where you can find weapons lying around for free. Note that this is an account-based game so many elements will be closed off to you if you don't have one.

Tips and Tricks

As a classic online shooting game, speed and accuracy are the most important things to consider. If you don't consider those your strong suits, focus mainly on movement and making yourself a harder target. The longer you survive, the more opportunities you'll have to fight back.

Combat Game Modes

There are four main modes:

  • Team Deathmatch - Work with others to get points by eliminating the other team.
  • Capture The Flag - Protect your flag and bring the enemy's flag back to your base.
  • Free For All - Everyone against everyone else.
  • Race - See how fast you can win.

Game Details

  • Developer: NadGames
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

Gameplay Footage

FAQs

Can I play Combat with my friends?

This is an online game with a focus on custom games, but you'll need to make an account to get access to the custom game option and then send the details to your friends so that they can find it and join.

title: Drift Boss
detail:
While having a car may be becoming a thing of the past, there's no drop in the production of car games like Drift Boss. Drifting is one of the most skillful moves that a driver can pull off in a car but it's also quite dangerous. The objective is to turn sharply while alternating between brakes, acceleration, and turning in order to maintain the angle. This 3D isometric driving game is challenging you to do the very same, but this time your very life depends on it! Or not, it could be a remote control car, but you at least don't want it to get wrecked since those things can be expensive.

About Drift Boss.

Drifting is arguably something that a majority of drivers will never ever attempt even if they have a big empty space to practice. The good news is that we have games like this one to help us live out that fantasy. It's a much more simplified and toy-like version of the real deal, but it does its job well. It's fun, challenging, and can be addictive considering how easy it is to jump in and start driving. It also provides a decent amount of opportunities to get power-ups and unlock new cares for enjoyment.

How to Play

Drift Boss is a driving game that only needs one button to control. This is because the angle and the perspective of the game show everything while the car moves at a constant speed toward the top of the screen. By default, the car will be angled to drive to the left. However, by tapping the Spacebar or Left Mouse Button, you can cause the car to drift left. Holding either button will cause the car to maintain driving left.

The goal is to get as far along a narrow track that will constantly turn sharply in an attempt to get you to fall off, forcing you to restart. While going along the track, you encounter bumps and dips in it that will affect your car's movement. You can also collect coins on the track which are used to buy power-ups called Boosters. There are three available:

Boosters

  • Double Score - Doubles the value of how far the car travels.
  • Car Insurance - Protects your car from falling while in effect.
  • Coin Rush - More cars will appear on the track.

Tips and Tricks

This game is all about precision and timing in order to last as long as possible. The challenge is to make sure your car stays as close to the center as you can in order to minimize the risk of falling off. Drifts are almost instant but executed with lag, so you have to be careful not to do them too early or too late.

Drift Boss Game Modes

Although the game only provides one track that changes color and randomly generates, there are other activities you can do to earn coins. Keep in mind that after succeeding, they will take time to reset.

  • Guess the Number - Try to determine the value of a three-digit number.
  • Match the Cards - A matching game with eight cards, but only four chances to miss.
  • Simon Says - Memorize three rounds of patterns consisting of shapes and colors.
  • Maze Challenge - A 2D maze where you must guide a diamond to a heart.
  • Loot Boxes - A free chest that refreshes every few minutes, and a premium chest unlocked with cards or ads.
  • Daily Rewards - A chance to get boosters and coins every day of the week.
  • Car Cards - Your collection of car cards that you can match to assemble new cars.

Drift Boss Cars

What would a car game be without cars? From the start screen, you can select what car you want by clicking on the arrows on either side of the car. Most cars will be locked but can be purchased with coins earned from the track, other activities, and Daily Rewards.

You can also get cars by collecting cards. These are earned from Loot Boxes, giving you between 1 and 10 Level 1 cards. From the start menu, you can go to your card collection to try and match three cards of the same type. This will cause them to merge and turn into a Level 2 card. Repeat the process until you obtain a Level 5 card which will unlock the related car.

Game Details

  • Developer: Marketjs
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile), and Android
  • Languages: English

Gameplay Footage

FAQs

What is the best car for drifting?

While all the cars in Drift Boss have the same stats, enthusiasts tend to rank sports cars as the top drifting cars. There aren't many in this game, but they look cool.

Does drifting damage your car?

In real life, consistent drifting will begin to wear on the tires which can create a dangerous situation. In this game, however, you don't have to worry about issues like that.

title: Toon Cup
detail:
We think that cartoons are only for children and many of them are but some of them remain relevant and it can be fun to see them playing together like in Toon Cup. When it comes to Cartoon Network shows, crossovers happen now and then so a universe where several different shows collide isn't inconceivable. What may be a bit harder to swallow is that they're all coming together to play a football tournament. But hey, stranger things have happened and probably will keep happening. Pick your cast of characters, head out to the field, and kick the ball around.

About Toon Cup

Whether or not you're familiar with Cartoon Network, you can tell from the characters just what kind of experience you can expect. This game is all about several different shows coming together and sending the best they have to offer to the field. Even though there's not much character interaction, their stats serve to show you just what kinds of characters they are. It's fun to play around with different combinations, finding that perfect balance for a game-winning team that you can take to the finals. Still, teams need some leadership and strategy which is what you're about to bring to the drawing board.

How to Play

Toon Cup is a 2D football game about cartoon characters playing against each other using the mouse.

Controls

  • W/Up Arrow - Move Up
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Down
  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right
  • Spacebar - Kick/Pass/Tackle

The goal of the game is to score more goals than the opposing team before the timer runs out. The time and score will be shown at the top of the screen. Each team can only have three players and ball possession switches depending on which side score the last goal. You can play a single Quick Match or try to win the cup by winning multiple games in a row in the Tournament. This is also how you can unlock new characters on the main menu.

If you choose a Quick Match, you'll automatically be assigned a random team of three characters, but the Tournament lets you pick your team. Each player has three stats: Speed, Kicking, and Tackling. After you've chosen your players, you'll be taken to the field. You'll always take control of the player closest to the ball, as indicated by a blue highlight ring. You can tackle an opposing player who has the ball to steal it. When you have the ball, you can pass it to a teammate in range or take it to the goal to try and score. To shoot, you need to hold the kick button to power the shot and aim to get it in the blue area for a perfect shot.

There are also gift boxes that will randomly appear on the field that your players can collect. Doing so can have differing effects from stunning the opposing team with thunderbolts to giving one of your players a protective shield.

Tips and Tricks

The key to any good team is balance. Even though some players may be stronger than others, not all of them are flawless. If you pick a player who is strong in one area, pick another player to make up for their weakest area. Do your best to keep track of your teammates and don't linger in one spot otherwise the opposing team will quickly gang up on you.

Game Details

  • Developer: Cartoon Network Games and Turner Broadcasting System
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile), iOS, and Android
  • Languages: English

Gameplay Footage

This may be a game about two teams playing football together, but it's sadly a single-player game against computer opponents.

title: Shot Trigger
detail:
Action movies are very unrealistic but that doesn't mean we won't have fantasies of flying through the air in slow motion amidst explosions and Shot Trigger captures that. You are a secret agent, a hitman, or some guy with a grudge who has easy access to rooftops. With this knowledge, you put on your best suit and grab your dual pistols to go for an action-filled run. You're doing this because the rooftops are filled with a bunch of bad guys who want to shoot you but you're going to be the one to shoot them first with the help of action movie powers.

About Shot Trigger

An endless runner presents itself in numerous ways and sometimes, it breaks itself down into levels so you're not always running. This game is an endless runner that wants you to enjoy the action moments in the level and then come down after you reach the end. It's very relaxed considering that most of the movement is done for you and you just need to focus on the best time to take your shot. When you've gotten that down, the rooftops will be yours to run across freely hopefully without having to worry about being shot.

How to Play

Shot Trigger is a 2D endless runner broken into levels where you're running and shooting using just the mouse. The action guy will do all the running, jumping, and aiming himself, so you just need to fire at the right time by pressing the Left Mouse Button. The goal of each level is to reach the end after shooting all the targets. The end is indicated by a pay phone and you'll be rewarded money for your efforts.

Before you start running, you can choose what pistols to take with you. They have no practical function and will simply change what your projectiles look like. Once you start, the action guy will start running from left to right. As they approach obstacles or gaps, they will jump into the air and aim using laser sights. While jumping through the air, he'll be moving in slow motion while nearby targets will start pulling out guns. You need to shoot at them when your sights line up to take them out. You only have since shots while jumping and will only reload once you land. If you take too long, the targets will shoot at you and you'll need to restart.

Tips and Tricks

There's not much to keep in mind while playing this game other than to prepare for upcoming shooting segments. You can see enemies and jumps coming ahead of time so just be ready to fire as you never know where your aiming will begin. As long as you hit the target, they'll be eliminated.

Game Details

  • Developer: SayGames Ltd
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile) and Android
  • Languages: English

Gameplay Footage

The game doesn't have a lot of features to offer in addition to levels and guns, but it is free to download and play wherever you find it.

title: Mini Royale 2 Io Nations
detail:
No one knows when the last battle royale game will be made but there are still plenty fighting it out for attention like Mini Royale 2. This is a colorful and stylized universe where humans and all sorts of creatures can get together and fight across huge and busy maps. You're one such being who has arrived with your starting equipment and a desire to reach the top of the rankings. To do that, you'll need to participate in a lot of matches and get the highest scores to get the best toys and be the most royal in this battle royale.

About Mini Royale 2

The idea of a battle royale used to be a very serious and heavy concept but now has become synonymous with running around the playground fighting other players. This game tries to make the battle royale idea quite light and entertaining with friendly and varied characters, lots of cosmetics, and ragdoll physics. The main thing you need to keep in mind is to make sure that you have a strong enough internet connection to play on the different servers. You'll be playing with lots of other players and it would be unfortunate if you were brought down by lag and poor ping.

How to Play

Mini Royale 2 is a 3D FPS battle royale game across various maps that you can play with a mouse and keyboard.

Controls

  • Cursor - Look/Aim
  • Left Mouse Button - Fire/Use
  • Right Mouse Button - Precise Aim
  • W - Move Forward
  • S - Move Backward
  • A - Move Left
  • D - Move Right
  • Spacebar - Jump
  • Shift - Walk
  • Mousewheel/Num. Keys - Cycle Weapons
  • Tab - Inventory
  • G - Drop Weapon
  • X - Use Adrenaline
  • V - Dance

There are other game modes, but the general goal revolves around killing opposing players while working with your teammates. Whenever you are killed, you will take a few seconds before respawning in your team zone. The match ends when a certain score has been reached or the timer runs out. The team with the highest score wins.

When you spawn in, you'll have a primary, secondary, and throwable weapon to choose between. You'll also have unlimited ammo so don't worry about having to collect more. Movement is freeform meaning that you take cover by hiding behind different objects and structures on the map. The scores of each team and the timer can be seen at the top of the screen.

With each match, you'll earn experience which will allow you to level up and unlock access to new gear, cosmetics, and game features. With enough playtime and an account, you can gain access to new skins, the ability to join clans, craft your own items, and take on contracts for additional rewards. Your character can be outfitted with various pieces and accessories to change their appearance. For quicker rewards, you can visit the shop to spend money earned in-game or to buy items and cosmetics directly. You can check the challenges in the upper right corner of the lobby for available tasks to complete.

This is a season-based game with inventory changing based on the theme. Keep this in mind if you're going after a certain item as it may not be available once the season ends.

Tips and Tricks

Like any competitive FPS game, you need to be able to move quickly and shoot accurately. You need to get in the habit of making sharp movements and jumping frequently to avoid being an easy target. Avoid running through open spaces and manage your clip size carefully so that you don't get caught reloading in a tough spot.

Mini Royale 2 Game Modes

There are several game modes currently available with more stated to be on the way:

  • Campaign - A single-player adventure where you progress through various matches to complete set objectives.
  • Team Deathmatch - Work with other players to eliminate opposing players and be the first to reach the most points!
  • Capture The Flag - Help your team steal the other team's flag and bring it back to your base to earn points.
  • Creative Mode - Flex your creativity to create your own battle royale map and share it with the community.

Game Details

  • Developer: Faraway
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

Gameplay Footage

How do I play with friends?

In the Mini Royale 2 lobby, there's a Private Match option in the lower right corner where you can create a match with specific settings and then send the link for it to your friends for them to join.

title: Subway Clash Remastered
detail:
Not every city has access to the convenience or terror of a subway system and sometimes they can be host to battles like in Subway Clash Remastered. For some unexplained reason, two armed forces of indeterminate size and funding have brought their fight to the literal underground. They both seem to have access to the same resources, but you and only you can step into the boots of a soldier who will join the fight alongside his allies. It comes down to you to clear the underground for public use once and for all! Or maybe just so that you and your buddies can use it.

About Subway Clash Remastered

Third-person shooters tend to be less serious in the shooter genre, and you get many oddly shaped character models. This game has you playing as a very bulky soldier with stubby limbs. He can certainly get the job done and carry all sorts of weapons easily, but this still makes him a pretty big target. The good news is that all of your enemies are pretty big targets too, so it's an even playing field and it comes down to who has the better aim. Just make sure you're around a corner before firing back or peeking your big bulky head out.

How to Play

Subway Clash Remastered is a 3D third-person shooting game about fighting it out in a subway using the mouse and keyboard.

Controls

  • Cursor - Aim/Look
  • Left Mouse Button - Fire/Attack
  • Right Mouse Button - Precise Aim
  • W/Up Arrow - Move Forward
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Backward
  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right
  • Spacebar - Jump
  • C - Crouch

The goal is to eliminate as many opponents as you can before the time runs out. The score and timer will be shown at the top of the screen and your health will be in the top left corner. When your health drops to zero, you'll be eliminated and will have to take a moment to respawn.

When the game starts or when you respawn, you'll be in a random part of the subway. You'll start armed with a machine gun and will need to run around to engage the enemy. Allies will have a green arrow over their heads while enemies will have a red marker. You can also pick up different weapons that can be found scattered about. You don't need to worry about reloading, just keep an eye on your health.

Tips and Tricks

The subway can seem like a maze and the biggest points of conflict are the most open areas so be cautious when approaching them. Stairs can also be dangerous as they can hide approaching enemies above or below. Don't neglect the crouch button when you have access to cover.

Game Details

  • Developer: Freeway Interactive
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

Is Subway Clash Remastered against other players?

Though it may seem like an online competitive game, it's placing you on a team and against a team with a lot of bots.

title: Rocket Clash 3d
detail:
There are many places where people could clash and many things that they could use to clash as revealed in Rocket Clash 3D. It appears that two factions are fighting for control of an underground area. You've got buff guys wearing striped blue shirts and berets and on the other side, you've got buff guys wearing red outfits and masks. The two must navigate the underground and fight each other with whatever weapons and gear they can find in the underground. If you plan to join the fight, be ready to sharpen all of your senses including your sense of direction.

About Rocket Clash 3D

This is just one such clash that is happening in the underground and you may be familiar with other such battles. This game is a shooter which doesn't have a lot to keep track of which means it's easier to just focus on the running and gunning. Games are fast and the map is small so there's not a lot that you need to remember and you don't need to be the most precise shooter. You've also got a lot of health so that you can make plenty of mistakes before being killed. Just be careful not to fall into the toxic ooze.

How to Play

Rocket Clash 3D is a 3D third-person shooter about running around an underground battlefield using the mouse and keyboard.

Controls

  • Cursor - Aim/Look
  • Left Mouse Button - Fire/Attack
  • Right Mouse Button - Precise Aim
  • W/Up Arrow - Move Forward
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Backward
  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right
  • Spacebar - Jump
  • C - Crouch

The goal is to take out enemy soldiers and rack up the most points before the match ends. The team scores and the timer are shown at the top of the screen. Your health and stats are shown in the top left corner of the screen and if it hits zero, you'll need to respawn. There are also achievements that you can aim to complete for stars.

When you're on the main menu, you can spend the stars that you've earned on upgrades to your health and weapons. You can also buy cosmetics to change your soldier's appearance. After that, you can jump right into the match and prepare to fight. You'll spawn in an area of the map that is under the control of your team. There's no map, so you'll need to navigate the underground using your own intuition. You have infinite ammo and start with a machine gun, but you can find grenade launchers and health kits around the area.

Tips and Tricks

This is an overall slower pace to this shooting game since the soldiers can't run super fast which is why jumping is so important to making yourself a harder target. There are lots of tight spots and sharp corners so maintain your awareness. Always have cover within reach so you can retreat as needed.

  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

title: Battle For The Galaxy
detail:
There are so many stories that could be set in space but many of them involve wide-scale battles taking place on other planets like in Battle for the Galaxy. It's the far future and humanity has managed to explore space further and establish colonies on other planets. Yet, despite these achievements, conflict is still rampant with humans still fighting amongst each other as well as the dangers of the galaxy. As the commander, you must lead your forces to fight and defend valuable areas of land so that you expand and extract the resources within.

About Battle for the Galaxy

The Starcraft series showed us years ago just how exciting and challenging it could be to fight space battles against a variety of enemies. This game takes those battles and simplifies them so that you can switch quickly between attack and defense. When you aren't fighting, you're doing your best to build up your base, gather, resources, and improve your forces so that you can be ready for whatever comes your way. Just know that it's a harsh galaxy out there and only the toughest survive.

How to Play

Battle for the Galaxy is a 3D top-down strategy game about fighting battles on other planets using the mouse. The entire game uses a UI that can be navigated with the cursor. To build and perform different actions, simply click on the related icon with the Left Mouse Button. Everything else runs automatically with buildings producing resources and your defenses protecting your base. To collect resources or train units, you need to click on the associated building and the related icon. The goal is to defend and expand your base to become a dominant force in the galaxy.

The home screen shows your base with your core facility being the most important part. As time goes on, you can earn Energy, Titanium, and Crystals for training units, building facilities, and purchasing upgrades. While in your base, enemies may occasionally attack with the intent to destroy your core, but any defenses and units you have will automatically fight to protect it. You can train units, perform processes, and build things, which will be completed over time or you can use resources to speed them up. As you level up and unlock more facilities, you'll also unlock more types of units.

When you have enough units, you can choose to attack enemy bases. This requires you to deploy units on the outskirts of the base upon which they will advance and attack the first building that comes into range. Your primary goal is to destroy the core, but you'll gain a higher score and more rewards if you destroy the whole base. Any units you lose will have to be trained again and if you lose all of your units, you will need to fall back.

Tips and Tricks

When you're first starting, try to avoid playing too aggressively. If you keep fighting and losing, you'll drain your resources which will make it harder for you to defend your base and build your forces back up. When training units, try to accommodate different base arrangements such as destroying walls, engaging defenses quickly, or keeping attacks at a distance.

Game Details

  • Developer: AMT Games
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile), iOS, and Android
  • Languages: English, Spanish, French, Italian, Portuguese, Polish, German, Japanese, Korean, Malaysian, Indonesian, Chinese, Czech, Farsi, and Russian

title: Ev.io
detail:
When it comes to playing competitive shooting games, many players choose to play for glory to prove their skill and Ev.io caters to that. It has an extra attached to it, but at its core, it's a fast-paced online shooter where players are trying to take each other out. It may or may not be set in a futuristic world or just a rendered simulated battlefield. This way, you can play around with experimental weaponry and leap through the air to get a bead on opponents. The higher in the rankings you climb, the more you'll be rewarded for your efforts both in and possibly out of the game.

About Ev.io

Multiplayer shooters can tend to blend together when they all fall on the usual conventions and gameplay. This game is quite solid in following the formula but manages to support it well so even the most casual player can join with ease. Those more familiar with this style of game will have an advantage and so you may find yourself playing against veterans over and over again. However, this is the work that you need to do to get the experience and develop the skills that you need to get to the top and grab those prizes.

How to Play

Ev.io is a 3D first-person shooter about competing against other players online using the mouse and keyboard.

Controls

  • Cursor - Look/Aim
  • Left Mouse Button - Fire/Attack
  • Right Mouse Button - Precise Aim
  • Mousewheel - Cycle Weapons
  • W - Move Forward
  • S - Move Backward
  • A - Move Left
  • D - Move Right
  • Spacebar - Jump (tap again for Double Jump)
  • Shift - Sprint
  • C - Crouch
  • R - Reload
  • Q/G/U/V/E - Use Secondary Items/Abilities

There are several modes, but the general goal revolves around getting as many kills as possible before the game ends. You can check your stats and gear in the bottom left corner of the screen and your weapons on the right side of the screen. When you're killed, depending on the mode, you'll respawn or be eliminated.

The game has a sci-fi theme with all the weapons being stylized as such. By playing and earning rewards, you can unlock new abilities and weapons to put into your loadout to suit your preferred style. This game is highly dependent on an online presence and since the rewards can be quite valuable, it's best to create an account to keep track of your progress if you decide to take this game seriously.

Tips and Tricks

The gameplay is designed for quick and precise movements which you will need to practice if you hope to survive. Players are constantly moving and jumping through the air and you should as well to make yourself a more difficult target. Don't spam your abilities as movement powers can be essential to retreating while explosives help with crowd control.

Ev.io Game Modes

There are currently five available modes to play:

  • Deathmatch - A free-for-all where you're trying to rack up the most kills.
  • Team Deathmatch - You and your teammates try to score high against the other team.
  • Sniper Shotgun - A match where you only get a shotgun, a sniper rifle, and a sword.
  • Battle Royale - Take out the other players to be the last one standing.
  • Survival - Try to outlast waves of enemies.

Game Details

  • Developer: Shopolic
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

title: Moto X3m Pool Party
detail:
Are you ready to do some awesome tricks on your motorcycle made explicitly to do tricks? I think even professionals are only sometimes truly ready for that but thankfully we've got games like Moto X3M Pool Party for safe bike experiments. Riding a motorcycle is a pretty dangerous activity and there's a whole sport around trying to make it as dangerous and radical as possible. You're playing a rider who laughs in the face of death or simply has an extremely high tolerance for pain. Even so, you'll want to do your best to help him make it to the end of the track even if it kills him… but, don't try to kill him.

About Moto X3M Pool Party

This isn't the first time this rider has undertaken such a task, but he's decided to pursue an event by the beach, in the sun, and with lots of pools. This game may be a vacation version of motorcycle sports and the levels have made an effort to provide wild tracks for you to drive through. Speed will help carry you through a lot of the danger, but you also need control so that your ride doesn't end early. If you're feeling confident, take a risk to perform some tricks for the people who came to watch.

How to Play

Moto X3M Pool Party is a 2D motorcycle game about riding through a series of tracks using the keyboard.

Controls

  • W/Up Arrow - Accelerate
  • S/Down Arrow - Brake/Reverse
  • A/Left Arrow - Lean Back
  • D/Right Arrow - Lean Forward
  • Spacebar - Reset

The goal of each level is to get to the end as quickly as possible. The faster you complete the level, the more stars you'll earn which can be used to unlock more bikes and riders. The end will be indicated by a space with a checkered pattern and as long as the rider's body or bike touches it, it will count as complete.

When the level starts, you're free to ride. The courses are laid out ahead of you and you simply need to follow the path to reach the end. Though the rider is sturdy, if his head or body comes into contact with anything solid, he'll be tossed from the bike. If he comes into contact with a hazard like spikes, the bike will explode. You'll also need to navigate floating platforms, tubes, and tracks going in loops. Trust the course mechanics to carry you through the more daunting sections.

You can perform flips and spins while airborne by leaning hard to the left or right, but be sure to land on the wheels or prepare to reset.

Tips and Tricks

Stability and balance are a must if you want to complete the levels effectively. You should always try to keep both wheels on the ground to maintain speed and control. Be careful when approaching edges or tight sections so that you don't slam your head.

Game Details

  • Developer: MadPuffers
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile), iOS, and Android
  • Languages: English
