title: Car Simulator Arena
detail:
People like to do all sorts of things with their cars from driving them casually to racing them to trying to destroy them like in Car Simulator Arena. While investing in such a hobby can eat into your savings, the digital world provides plenty of space, cars, and resets as you want to drive and crash to your heart's content. It's an open driving playground but you can populate it with other drivers to add more chaos. At the end of the day, it's all about who can drive the fattest and who's still in one piece at the end.

About Car Simulator Arena

Demolition derby and other car crashing events can be very dangerous which is why we turn to video games for a safer experience. This game is just what you need to get a taste of what it would be like to drive a car in an open area full of structures and places to crash. You'll have other vehicles to test your driving skills as well as other drivers trying to get a piece of you. You may crash and spin out quite a bit, but that just gives you a reason to choose another car and see if you can do even better.

How to Play

Car Simulator Arena is a 3D driving game about pulling tricks and wrecking cars using the keyboard.

Controls

  • Up Arrow - Accelerate
  • Down Arrow - Brake/Reverse
  • Left Arrow - Turn Left
  • Right Arrow - Turn Right
  • Shift - Use Nitro
  • ZXCV - Flip/Spin
  • WASD - Change Camera
  • R - Respawn

There are two modes available Free Roam and Derby. The goal of the first is to drive around and see how many tricks and crashes you can pull off. The latter is about trying to survive among other drivers that will be aiming for you. Before the game begins, you have the option to choose whatever car or vehicle you want.

There's no guidance or clear objective to what you're doing, you're just driving. The car's speed and technical info are located in the bottom right corner of the screen. A blue meter indicates how much nitro you have and when it runs out, you need to wait for it to refill. If your vehicle gets too wrecked, you can respawn fully fixed. There will be ramps, loops, spirals, and other structures for you to drive around so you can challenge your driving ability.

You'll also get indicators marking your air time and drift time whenever you try to pull off either. Note that depending on the vehicle, it may not be capable of drifting. When airborne, you can spin and flip the vehicle to perform tricks.

Tips and Tricks

The different vehicles aren't just skins, they all have their strengths and weaknesses. Some are built for speed, others for handling, and some may have very slow nitro recharges. Experiment with the different types and see which one best suits your driving.

Game Details

  • Developer: Brightest Games
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

Gameplay Footage

FAQs

Is this helpful for practicing driving?

Car Simulator Arena creates a no-risk environment for you to drive wildly without restriction or consequence and so should not be used as a driving tool.

title: Kogama: Sonic Dash 2
detail:
While searching the internet for games to play, you may have come across the names "Kogama" and "Sonic" which is why you're here looking at Kogama: Sonic Dash 2. The Kogama games cover a variety of genres and gameplay styles to the point where they try to incorporate other game characters. In this instance, Sonic has been brought into the Kogama universe to do what he does best: Run. But he's not alone as other characters from the Sonic series are here to show off their running skills as well. Just how fast can you make it through the obstacle course?

About Kogama: Sonic Dash 2

The Kogama games have a sharp polygonal style that makes them look like toys which might be why they fight as gaming titles. This game applies the Kogama model to Sonic and his friends while having them race through various obstacle courses. A lot of elements are taken from the Sonic games but the rules have been changed to those of Kogama. It can take a bit of getting used to, but once you do, you may find yourself exploring the courses in full to find the best ways while trying to see all that there is to see in them.

How to Play

Kogama: Sonic Dash 2 is a 3D running game focused on navigating obstacle courses using the mouse and keyboard.

Controls

  • Cursor - Look/Turn
  • W/Up Arrow - Move Forward
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Backward
  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right
  • Spacebar - Jump

The goal is to get to the end of the obstacle course as quickly as possible. Your character will have a health bar shown in the top left corner. If it runs out, you'll be eliminated from the course. You can choose your character before starting and check the different stats affecting speed, jumping, friction, Parkour, and health.

After you pick your character, you'll be dropped into a lobby where you can look at the various options. To start the game, move to the glowing sign that says "Run". After a few moments, you'll be dropped at the start of the course and can start moving. While running, you'll encounter obstacles and traps that will slow you down. The rings that are common to Sonic are not collectibles, being solid and usable as platforms. There will also be times when the path will split with signs showing what to expect down each one. The run ends when someone reaches the flag at the end of the course.

Tips and Tricks

If you're unfamiliar with a Kogama game, spend some time in the lobby to get a feel for the movement. Always remember that the mouse changes both your view and position, so don't get disoriented by it. The rings are there as a distraction and should only be used to get over obstacles or surpass an opponent.

  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)

detail:
Considering that the Minecraft world has always been brutal, combining it with a competitive genre makes sense; that's why we have Voxiom IO. This is a Minecraft universe where being a soldier and crafting is the secondary. You still have all the tools you need to get things off and out of the ground so that you can craft gear for the battles ahead. Of course, that all depends on how lucky you are when it comes to finding hidden weapons and then being called on to defend yourself in battle since a shovel can only get you so far.

About Voxiom IO

Minecraft has had online elements for years but that has never been the main point of the game which is why other titles are stepping in. This game is all about setting up battles between players with fighting being the first and crafting coming second. It also takes a more modern approach by giving people access to firearms instead of swords. Since the blocky characters can move so precisely or smoothly, it challenges you to be more creative with how you need to position yourself step by step so that you can respond quickly and accurately. Minecraft is tough, but people are tougher.

How to Play

Voxiom IO is a 3D first-person shooting game set in a Minecraft kind of universe that you play with the mouse and keyboard.

Controls

  • Cursor - Look/Aim
  • Left Mouse Button - Use/Fire
  • Right Mouse Button - Precise Aim
  • W - Move Forward
  • S - Move Backward
  • A - Move Left
  • D - Move Right
  • Spacebar - Jump
  • Shift - Sprint
  • C - Crouch
  • E - Interact
  • Mousewheel/Num. Keys - Cycle Through Equipment
  • X - Open Inventory

There are different game modes, but in general, you'll want to do your best to just stay alive. Your health is shown in the bottom left side of the screen while your equipment is shown in the bottom right. When your health drops to zero, you'll be eliminated.

In the main lobby, you can visit the shop and buy new equipment for your avatar for them to put into their loadout. You can then choose your game and drop into the waiting room before dropping into the battlefield. You'll always start with a shovel and maybe some blocks to use as you wish. You can start exploring the area and attempt to find materials and equipment while looking for other players. You'll have limited slots for on-hand and backpack items as well as slots for your ammo. The field will also be enclosed by a mass of toxic fog that will close in periodically and force you into tighter spaces.

As you play and succeed, you'll level up which will net you more rewards and access to additional features.

Tips and Tricks

The structures are popular areas because they provide cover and treasure chests but it's worth it to risk running around in the field to find hidden treasure marked with an X. As the safe space gets smaller, maintain awareness and try to avoid open spaces. Use obstacles and chest-high walls to stay safe.

Voxiom IO Game Modes

The game currently has five modes to try:

  • Capture The Gems - Fight, and mine to get to the gems!
  • Survival - See how long you can last against waves of enemies.
  • Battle Royale - You versus everyone else to be the last one standing.
  • Free For All - Take down opponents and rack up the most points.
  • Custom - Make your own match to play.

Game Details

  • Developer: Voxiom
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

Gameplay Footage

FAQs

Does Voxiom IO offer online features?

Being an IO game, it's designed for online play but casual options are limited and you'll need to create an account to get access to everything, including your own statistics.

title: Crazy Shooters 2
detail:
The competitive gaming scene is so wild that it's hard to believe some of the movements players can pull off such as in the chaos of Crazy Shooters 2. It creates an environment where only chaos reigns and only those capable of running, jumping, and shooting will survive. It's unknown if there is any other way to live in such a world, but the competitors seem to be purely sustained by the chaos of the fray. It may take you a while to get used to all of the chaos but once you do, you'd best be prepared to ride it into battle.

About Crazy Shooters 2

Some games are based on older models that are still in play today because they're pretty fast and straightforward. This game feels somewhat like classic Counter-Strike but with the hinges a bit looser and the processing pumped up in the name of speed. There's only one thing you need to keep in mind: You are against everyone else out there which is strange because it's a team game. Your teammates may be after the same opponents but they're looking out for themselves because it's difficult to keep track of everything let alone your allies. Be ready to fire in random directions while staying on the move.

How to Play

Crazy Shooters 2 is a 3D first-person competitive shooter that you play with the mouse and keyboard.

Controls

  • Cursor - Look/Aim
  • Left Mouse Button - Attack/Fire
  • Right Mouse Button - Precise Aim
  • W/Up Arrow - Move Forward
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Backward
  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right
  • Mouse wheel/Num. Keys - Cycle Weapons
  • R - Reload
  • Spacebar - Jump
  • Shift - Sprint

The goal of the game is to help your team win by earning more points than the opposing team before the match ends. Points and time can be seen at the top of the screen.

When the match starts, you'll spawn on one side along with your teammates and be free to start running around. You'll have a whole selection of weapons to wield as shown at the top of the screen. You can cycle through them as much as you want but keep in mind that ammo is limited. Teammates will be highlighted with names above their heads while enemies will not. If you're killed in battle, you'll respawn after a few seconds.

Tips and Tricks

This is a classic FPS which means that you need to keep moving and make your shots count. To keep pressure off in a tight situation, fire toward your enemies so that they'll also be defensive. Remember to jump frequently and always have an escape route when braving the open areas of the map.

Game Details

  • Developer: FreezeNova
  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile)
  • Languages: English

title: Strike Galaxy Attack
detail:
Going back to the early arcade days, you can see a style of game that involves a spaceship flying up and shooting everything like in Strike Galaxy Attack. Return to a time when all major intergalactic conflicts could be resolved by a surprisingly adaptable spaceship. It's unknown who you're working for or who the enemy is, but you're being sent into dangerous territory. Your side can only afford to send only one ship but it's a pretty advanced ship that has the power to take on entire fleets. They may be made up of birds but they are fleets, or perhaps flocks are more accurate.

About Strike Galaxy Attack

The reason these kinds of spaceship games do well and remain popular is because they're straightforward. All you need to do in this game is fly the ship and shoot all the things that aren't you. A major part of the game has been taken care of so you just need to worry about moving the ship and staying alive. It doesn't matter how powerful you are if you can't avoid being hit by these cute and colorful space birds. If you can do that, then nothing can stop you and you'll be the top bird in this part of the galaxy.

How to Play

Strike Galaxy Attack is a 2D arcade shooter about a spaceship going after an endless flock of birds using the keyboard.

Controls

  • W/Up Arrow - Move Up
  • S/Down Arrow - Move Down
  • A/Left Arrow - Move Left
  • D/Right Arrow - Move Right

The goal of the game is to complete the levels by defeating all the waves of enemies within them. Your ship will be firing constantly in a straight line and its details are shown at the bottom of the screen while enemies will fly in from the sides or the top of the screen. It only has armor for one hit so any projectile that touches it will instantly destroy it.

Before you start, you can take on the Adventure which is level-based while the Endless mode will let you keep going until you're taken down. Whenever you do begin, your spaceship will start at the bottom of the screen and will constantly be firing a stream of shots. When enemies start to appear, you can move your ship to change the trajectory of the shots and eliminate them. Destroyed enemies can drop coins for additional power-ups or they'll drop upgrades that take effect as soon as you collect them. They can change how your ship looks, the type of shots they use, and their attack range. Once all the waves are defeated, the level will be completed and you can move on.

Tips and Tricks

As an arcade shooter, it's all about getting powerful enough so that you can cover the entire screen with your gunfire. You need to take advantage of the space and learn how to weave your ship through shops. Also, be careful not to collect power-ups that reset your ship's level.

Game Details

  • Platforms: Web Browser (PC and mobile), iOS, and Android
  • Languages: English
